   20: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
   21: %%% Purpose: Test suite for the 'lists' module.
   22: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   23: 
   24: -module(lists_SUITE).
   25: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   26: 
   27: %% Test server specific exports
   28: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   29: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   30: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   31: 
   32: %% Test cases must be exported.
   33: -export([member/1, reverse/1,
   34: 	 keymember/1, keysearch_keyfind/1,
   35: 	 keystore/1, keytake/1, keyreplace/1,
   36: 	 append_1/1, append_2/1,
   37: 	 seq_loop/1, seq_2/1, seq_3/1, seq_2_e/1, seq_3_e/1,
   38: 
   39: 	 sublist_2/1, sublist_3/1, sublist_2_e/1, sublist_3_e/1,
   40: 	 flatten_1/1, flatten_2/1, flatten_1_e/1, flatten_2_e/1,
   41: 	 dropwhile/1, takewhile/1,
   42: 	 sort_1/1, sort_stable/1, merge/1, rmerge/1, sort_rand/1,
   43: 	 usort_1/1, usort_stable/1, umerge/1, rumerge/1,usort_rand/1,
   44: 	 keymerge/1, rkeymerge/1,
   45: 	 keysort_1/1, keysort_i/1, keysort_stable/1,
   46: 	 keysort_rand/1, keysort_error/1,
   47: 	 ukeymerge/1, rukeymerge/1,
   48: 	 ukeysort_1/1, ukeysort_i/1, ukeysort_stable/1,
   49: 	 ukeysort_rand/1, ukeysort_error/1,
   50: 	 funmerge/1, rfunmerge/1,
   51: 	 funsort_1/1, funsort_stable/1, funsort_rand/1,
   52: 	 funsort_error/1,
   53: 	 ufunmerge/1, rufunmerge/1,
   54: 	 ufunsort_1/1, ufunsort_stable/1, ufunsort_rand/1,
   55: 	 ufunsort_error/1,
   56: 	 uniq_1/1, uniq_2/1,
   57: 	 zip_unzip/1, zip_unzip3/1, zipwith/1, zipwith3/1,
   58: 	 filter_partition/1, 
   59: 	 join/1,
   60: 	 otp_5939/1, otp_6023/1, otp_6606/1, otp_7230/1,
   61: 	 suffix/1, subtract/1, droplast/1, search/1, hof/1,
   62: 	 enumerate/1, error_info/1]).
   63: 
   64: %% Sort randomized lists until stopped.
   65: %%
   66: %% If you update some of the sort or merge functions, you should
   67: %% definitely let sort_loop work for a couple of hours or days. Try
   68: %% both sort_loop/0 and sort_loop/1 with a small argument (30-50 say).
   69: 
   70: -export([sort_loop/0, sort_loop/1, sloop/1]).
   71: 
   72: %% Internal export.
   73: -export([make_fun/1]).
   74: 
   75: %%
   76: %% all/1
   77: %%
   78: suite() ->
   79:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   80:      {timetrap,{minutes,4}}].
   81: 
   82: all() -> 
   83:     [{group, append},
   84:      {group, key},
   85:      {group, sort},
   86:      {group, usort},
   87:      {group, keysort},
   88:      {group, ukeysort},
   89:      {group, uniq},
   90:      {group, funsort},
   91:      {group, ufunsort},
   92:      {group, sublist},
   93:      {group, flatten},
   94:      {group, seq},
   95:      {group, tickets},
   96:      {group, zip},
   97:      {group, misc}].
   98: 
   99: groups() -> 
  100:     [{append, [parallel], [append_1, append_2]},
  101:      {usort, [parallel],
  102:       [umerge, rumerge, usort_1, usort_rand, usort_stable]},
  103:      {keysort, [parallel],
  104:       [keymerge, rkeymerge, keysort_1, keysort_rand,
  105:        keysort_i, keysort_stable, keysort_error]},
  106:      {key, [parallel], [keymember, keysearch_keyfind, keystore,
  107: 			keytake, keyreplace]},
  108:      {sort,[parallel],[merge, rmerge, sort_1, sort_rand]},
  109:      {ukeysort, [parallel],
  110:       [ukeymerge, rukeymerge, ukeysort_1, ukeysort_rand,
  111:        ukeysort_i, ukeysort_stable, ukeysort_error]},
  112:      {funsort, [parallel],
  113:       [funmerge, rfunmerge, funsort_1, funsort_stable,
  114:        funsort_error, funsort_rand]},
  115:      {ufunsort, [parallel],
  116:       [ufunmerge, rufunmerge, ufunsort_1, ufunsort_stable,
  117:        ufunsort_error, ufunsort_rand]},
  118:      {seq, [parallel], [seq_loop, seq_2, seq_3, seq_2_e, seq_3_e]},
  119:      {sublist, [parallel],
  120:       [sublist_2, sublist_3, sublist_2_e, sublist_3_e]},
  121:      {flatten, [parallel],
  122:       [flatten_1, flatten_2, flatten_1_e, flatten_2_e]},
  123:      {tickets, [parallel], [otp_5939, otp_6023, otp_6606, otp_7230]},
  124:      {zip, [parallel], [zip_unzip, zip_unzip3, zipwith, zipwith3]},
  125:      {uniq, [parallel], [uniq_1, uniq_2]},
  126:      {misc, [parallel], [reverse, member, dropwhile, takewhile,
  127: 			 filter_partition, suffix, subtract, join,
  128: 			 hof, droplast, search, enumerate, error_info]}
  129:     ].
  130: 
  131: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  132:     Config.
  133: 
  134: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  135:     ok.
  136: 
  137: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  138:     Config.
  139: 
  140: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  141:     Config.
  142: 
  143: 
  144: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  145:     Config.
  146: 
  147: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
  148:     ok.
  149: 
  150: %%
  151: %% Test cases starts here.
  152: %%
  153: 
  154: append_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  155:     "abcdef"=lists:append(["abc","def"]),
  156:     [hej, du,[glade, [bagare]]]=
  157: 	lists:append([[hej], [du], [[glade, [bagare]]]]),
  158:     [10, [elem]]=lists:append([[10], [[elem]]]),
  159:     ok.
  160: 
  161: append_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  162:     "abcdef"=lists:append("abc", "def"),
  163:     [hej, du]=lists:append([hej], [du]),
  164:     [10, [elem]]=lists:append([10], [[elem]]),
  165: 
  166:     %% Trapping, both crashing and otherwise.
  167:     [append_trapping_1(N) || N <- lists:seq(0, 20)],
  168: 
  169:     ok.
  170: 
  171: append_trapping_1(N) ->
  172:     List = lists:duplicate(N + (1 bsl N), gurka),
  173:     ImproperList = List ++ crash,
  174: 
  175:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch (ImproperList ++ [])),
  176: 
  177:     [3, 2, 1 | List] = lists:reverse(List ++ [1, 2, 3]),
  178: 
  179:     ok.
  180: 
  181: %% Tests the lists:reverse() implementation. The function is
  182: %% `non-blocking', and only processes a fixed number of elements at a
  183: %% time.
  184: reverse(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  185:     reverse_test(0),
  186:     reverse_test(1),
  187:     reverse_test(2),
  188:     reverse_test(128),
  189:     reverse_test(256),
  190:     reverse_test(1000),
  191:     reverse_test(1998),
  192:     reverse_test(1999),
  193:     reverse_test(2000),
  194:     reverse_test(2001),
  195:     reverse_test(3998),
  196:     reverse_test(3999),
  197:     reverse_test(4000),
  198:     reverse_test(4001),
  199:     reverse_test(60001),
  200:     reverse_test(100007),
  201:     ok.
  202: 
  203: reverse_test(0) ->
  204:     case lists:reverse([]) of
  205: 	[] ->
  206: 	    ok;
  207: 	_Other ->
  208: 	    error
  209:     end;
  210: reverse_test(Num) ->
  211:     List0 = ['The Element'|lists:duplicate(Num, 'Ele')],
  212:     List = lists:reverse(List0),
  213:     ['Ele'|_] = List,
  214:     'The Element' = lists:last(List),
  215:     List0 = lists:reverse(List),
  216:     ok.
  217: 
  218: %% Test the lists:member() implementation.  This test case depends on
  219: %% lists:reverse() to work, wich is tested in a separate test case.
  220: member(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  221:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch lists:member(45, {a,b,c})),
  222:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch lists:member(45, [0|non_list_tail])),
  223:     false = lists:member(4233, []),
  224:     member_test(1),
  225:     member_test(100),
  226:     member_test(256),
  227:     member_test(1000),
  228:     member_test(1998),
  229:     member_test(1999),
  230:     member_test(2000),
  231:     member_test(2001),
  232:     member_test(3998),
  233:     member_test(3999),
  234:     member_test(4000),
  235:     member_test(4001),
  236:     member_test(100008),
  237:     ok.
  238: 
  239: member_test(Num) ->
  240:     List0 = ['The Element'|lists:duplicate(Num, 'Elem')],
  241:     true = lists:member('The Element', List0),
  242:     true = lists:member('Elem', List0),
  243:     false = lists:member(arne_anka, List0),
  244:     false = lists:member({a,b,c}, List0),
  245:     List = lists:reverse(List0),
  246:     true = lists:member('The Element', List),
  247:     true = lists:member('Elem', List),
  248:     false = lists:member(arne_anka, List),
  249:     false = lists:member({a,b,c}, List).
  250: 
  251: keymember(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  252:     false = lists:keymember(anything_goes, 1, []),
  253:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch lists:keymember(anything_goes, -1, [])),
  254:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch lists:keymember(anything_goes, 0, [])),
  255:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch lists:keymember(anything_goes, 1, {1,2,3})),
  256:     List = [{52.0,a},{-19,b,c},{37.5,d},an_atom,42.0,{39},{45,{x,y,z}}],
  257: 
  258:     false = lists:keymember(333, 5, List),
  259:     false = lists:keymember(333, 999, List),
  260:     false = lists:keymember(37, 1, List),
  261: 
  262:     true = lists:keymember(52.0, 1, List),
  263:     true = lists:keymember(52, 1, List),
  264:     true = lists:keymember(-19, 1, List),
  265:     true = lists:keymember(-19.0, 1, List),
  266:     true = lists:keymember(37.5, 1, List),
  267:     true = lists:keymember(39, 1, List),
  268:     true = lists:keymember(39.0, 1, List),
  269:     true = lists:keymember(45, 1, List),
  270:     true = lists:keymember(45.0, 1, List),
  271: 
  272:     true = lists:keymember(a, 2, List),
  273:     true = lists:keymember(b, 2, List),
  274:     true = lists:keymember(c, 3, List),
  275:     true = lists:keymember(d, 2, List),
  276:     true = lists:keymember({x,y,z}, 2, List),
  277: 
  278:     Long0 = lists:seq(1, 100007),
  279:     false = lists:keymember(kalle, 1, Long0),
  280:     Long = lists:foldl(fun(E, A) -> [{1/E,E}|A] end, [], Long0),
  281:     true = lists:keymember(1, 2, Long),
  282:     true = lists:keymember(2, 2, Long),
  283:     true = lists:keymember(1.0, 2, Long),
  284:     true = lists:keymember(2.0, 2, Long),
  285:     true = lists:keymember(100006, 2, Long),
  286:     ok.
  287: 
  288: keysearch_keyfind(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  289:     false = key_search_find(anything_goes, 1, []),
  290:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch key_search_find(anything_goes, -1, [])),
  291:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch key_search_find(anything_goes, 0, [])),
  292:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch key_search_find(anything_goes, 1, {1,2,3})),
  293: 
  294:     First = {x,42.0},
  295:     Second = {y,-77},
  296:     Third = {z,[a,b,c],{5.0}},
  297:     List = [First,Second,Third],
  298: 
  299:     false = key_search_find(333, 1, []),
  300:     false = key_search_find(333, 5, List),
  301:     false = key_search_find(333, 999, List),
  302:     false = key_search_find(37, 1, List),
  303: 
  304:     {value,First} = key_search_find(42, 2, List),
  305:     {value,First} = key_search_find(42.0, 2, List),
  306: 
  307:     {value,Second} = key_search_find(-77, 2, List),
  308:     {value,Second} = key_search_find(-77.0, 2, List),
  309: 
  310:     {value,Third} = key_search_find(z, 1, List),
  311:     {value,Third} = key_search_find([a,b,c], 2, List),
  312:     {value,Third} = key_search_find({5}, 3, List),
  313:     {value,Third} = key_search_find({5.0}, 3, List),
  314: 
  315:     Long0 = lists:seq(1, 100007),
  316:     false = key_search_find(kalle, 1, Long0),
  317:     Long = lists:foldl(fun(E, A) -> [{1/E,float(E)}|A] end, [], Long0),
  318:     {value,{_,1.0}} = key_search_find(1, 2, Long),
  319:     {value,{_,1.0}} = key_search_find(1.0, 2, Long),
  320:     {value,{_,2.0}} = key_search_find(2, 2, Long),
  321:     {value,{_,2.0}} = key_search_find(2.0, 2, Long),
  322:     {value,{_,33988.0}} = key_search_find(33988, 2, Long),
  323:     {value,{_,33988.0}} = key_search_find(33988.0, 2, Long),
  324:     ok.
  325: 
  326: %% Test both lists:keysearch/3 and lists:keyfind/3. The only
  327: %% difference between these two functions is that lists:keysearch/3
  328: %% wraps a successfully returned tuple in a value tuple.
  329: %%
  330: key_search_find(Key, Pos, List) ->
  331:     case lists:keyfind(Key, Pos, List) of
  332: 	false ->
  333: 	    false = lists:keysearch(Key, Pos, List);
  334: 	Tuple when is_tuple(Tuple) ->
  335: 	    {value,Tuple} = lists:keysearch(Key, Pos, List)
  336:     end.
  337: 
  338: dropwhile(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  339:     F = fun(C) -> C =:= $@ end,
  340: 
  341:     [] = lists:dropwhile(F, []),
  342:     [a] = lists:dropwhile(F, [a]),
  343:     [a,b] = lists:dropwhile(F, [a,b]),
  344:     [a,b,c] = lists:dropwhile(F, [a,b,c]),
  345: 
  346:     [] = lists:dropwhile(F, [$@]),
  347:     [] = lists:dropwhile(F, [$@,$@]),
  348:     [a,$@] = lists:dropwhile(F, [$@,a,$@]),
  349: 
  350:     [$k] = lists:dropwhile(F, [$@,$k]),
  351:     [$k,$l] = lists:dropwhile(F, [$@,$@,$k,$l]),
  352:     [a] = lists:dropwhile(F, [$@,$@,$@,a]),
  353: 
  354:     [a,$@,b] = lists:dropwhile(F, [$@,a,$@,b]),
  355:     [a,$@,b] = lists:dropwhile(F, [$@,$@,a,$@,b]),
  356:     [a,$@,b] = lists:dropwhile(F, [$@,$@,$@,a,$@,b]),
  357: 
  358:     Long = lists:seq(1, 1024),
  359:     Shorter = lists:seq(800, 1024),
  360: 
  361:     Shorter = lists:dropwhile(fun(E) -> E < 800 end, Long),
  362: 
  363:     ok.
  364: 
  365: takewhile(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  366:     F = fun(C) -> C =/= $@ end,
  367: 
  368:     [] = lists:takewhile(F, []),
  369:     [a] = lists:takewhile(F, [a]),
  370:     [a,b] = lists:takewhile(F, [a,b]),
  371:     [a,b,c] = lists:takewhile(F, [a,b,c]),
  372: 
  373:     [] = lists:takewhile(F, [$@]),
  374:     [] = lists:takewhile(F, [$@,$@]),
  375:     [a] = lists:takewhile(F, [a,$@]),
  376: 
  377:     [$k] = lists:takewhile(F, [$k,$@]),
  378:     [$k,$l] = lists:takewhile(F, [$k,$l,$@,$@]),
  379:     [a] = lists:takewhile(F, [a,$@,$@,$@]),
  380: 
  381:     [] = lists:takewhile(F, [$@,a,$@,b]),
  382:     [] = lists:takewhile(F, [$@,$@,a,$@,b]),
  383:     [] = lists:takewhile(F, [$@,$@,$@,a,$@,b]),
  384: 
  385:     Long = lists:seq(1, 1024),
  386:     Shorter = lists:seq(1, 400),
  387: 
  388:     Shorter = lists:takewhile(fun(E) -> E =< 400 end, Long),
  389: 
  390:     ok.
  391: 
  392: keystore(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  393:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch lists:keystore(key, 0, [], {1})),
  394:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch lists:keystore(key, 1, {}, {})),
  395:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch lists:keystore(key, 1, {a,b}, {})),
  396:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:keystore(a, 2, [{1,a}], b)),
  397:     T = {k,17},
  398:     [T] = lists:keystore(a, 2, [], T),
  399:     [{1,a},{2,b},{k,17}] = lists:keystore(c, 2, [{1,a},{2,b}],T),
  400:     L = [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c}],
  401:     [{k,17},{2,b},{3,c}] = lists:keystore(a, 2, L, T),
  402:     [{1,a},{k,17},{3,c}] = lists:keystore(b, 2, L, T),
  403:     [{1,a},{2,b},{k,17}] = lists:keystore(c, 2, L, T),
  404:     [{2,b}] = lists:keystore(a, 2, [{1,a}], {2,b}),
  405:     [{1,a}] = lists:keystore(foo, 1, [], {1,a}),
  406:     ok.
  407: 
  408: keytake(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  409:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch lists:keytake(key, 0, [])),
  410:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch lists:keytake(key, 1, {})),
  411:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch lists:keytake(key, 1, {a,b})),
  412:     false = lists:keytake(key, 2, [{a}]),
  413:     false = lists:keytake(key, 1, [a]),
  414:     false = lists:keytake(k, 1, []),
  415:     false = lists:keytake(k, 1, [{a},{b},{c}]),
  416:     L = [{a,1},{b,2},{c,3}],
  417:     {value,{a,1},[{b,2},{c,3}]} = lists:keytake(1, 2, L),
  418:     {value,{b,2},[{a,1},{c,3}]} = lists:keytake(2, 2, L),
  419:     {value,{c,3},[{a,1},{b,2}]} = lists:keytake(3, 2, L),
  420:     false = lists:keytake(4, 2, L),
  421:     ok.
  422: 
  423: %% Test lists:keyreplace/4.
  424: keyreplace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  425:     [{new,42}] = lists:keyreplace(k, 1, [{k,1}], {new,42}),
  426:     [atom,{new,a,b}] = lists:keyreplace(k, 1, [atom,{k,1}], {new,a,b}),
  427:     [a,{x,y,z}] = lists:keyreplace(a, 5, [a,{x,y,z}], {no,use}),
  428: 
  429:     %% Error cases.
  430:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch lists:keyreplace(k, 1, [], not_tuple)),
  431:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch lists:keyreplace(k, 0, [], {a,b})),
  432:     ok.
  433: 
  434: merge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  435: 
  436:     %% merge list of lists
  437:     [] = lists:merge([]),
  438:     [] = lists:merge([[]]),
  439:     [] = lists:merge([[],[]]),
  440:     [] = lists:merge([[],[],[]]),
  441:     [1] = lists:merge([[1]]),
  442:     [1,1,2,2] = lists:merge([[1,2],[1,2]]),
  443:     [1] = lists:merge([[1],[],[]]),
  444:     [1] = lists:merge([[],[1],[]]),
  445:     [1] = lists:merge([[],[],[1]]),
  446:     [1,2] = lists:merge([[1],[2],[]]),
  447:     [1,2] = lists:merge([[1],[],[2]]),
  448:     [1,2] = lists:merge([[],[1],[2]]),
  449:     [1,2,3,4,5,6] = lists:merge([[1,2],[],[5,6],[],[3,4],[]]),
  450:     [1,2,3,4] = lists:merge([[4],[3],[2],[1]]),
  451:     [1,2,3,4,5] = lists:merge([[1],[2],[3],[4],[5]]),
  452:     [1,2,3,4,5,6] = lists:merge([[1],[2],[3],[4],[5],[6]]),
  453:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9] =
  454: 	lists:merge([[1],[2],[3],[4],[5],[6],[7],[8],[9]]),
  455:     Seq = lists:seq(1,100),
  456:     true = Seq == lists:merge(lists:map(fun(E) -> [E] end, Seq)),
  457: 
  458:     Two = [1,2],
  459:     Six = [1,2,3,4,5,6],
  460: 
  461:     %% 2-way merge
  462:     [] = lists:merge([], []),
  463:     Two = lists:merge(Two, []),
  464:     Two = lists:merge([], Two),
  465:     Six = lists:merge([1,3,5], [2,4,6]),
  466:     Six = lists:merge([2,4,6], [1,3,5]),
  467:     Six = lists:merge([1,2,3], [4,5,6]),
  468:     Six = lists:merge([4,5,6], [1,2,3]),
  469:     Six = lists:merge([1,2,5],[3,4,6]),
  470:     [1,2,3,5,7] = lists:merge([1,3,5,7], [2]),
  471:     [1,2,3,4,5,7] = lists:merge([1,3,5,7], [2,4]),
  472:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] = lists:merge([1,3,5,7], [2,4,6]),
  473:     [1,2,3,5,7] = lists:merge([2], [1,3,5,7]),
  474:     [1,2,3,4,5,7] = lists:merge([2,4], [1,3,5,7]),
  475:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] = lists:merge([2,4,6], [1,3,5,7]),
  476: 
  477:     %% 3-way merge
  478:     [] = lists:merge3([], [], []),
  479:     Two = lists:merge3([], [], Two),
  480:     Two = lists:merge3([], Two, []),
  481:     Two = lists:merge3(Two, [], []),
  482:     Six = lists:merge3([], [1,3,5], [2,4,6]),
  483:     Six = lists:merge3([1,3,5], [], [2,4,6]),
  484:     Six = lists:merge3([1,3,5], [2,4,6], []),
  485:     Nine = lists:merge3([1,4,7],[2,5,8],[3,6,9]),
  486:     Nine = lists:merge3([1,4,7],[3,6,9],[2,5,8]),
  487:     Nine = lists:merge3([3,6,9],[1,4,7],[2,5,8]),
  488:     Nine = lists:merge3([4,5,6],[1,2,3],[7,8,9]),
  489:     Nine = lists:merge3([1,2,3],[4,5,6],[7,8,9]),
  490:     Nine = lists:merge3([7,8,9],[4,5,6],[1,2,3]),
  491:     Nine = lists:merge3([4,5,6],[7,8,9],[1,2,3]),
  492: 
  493:     ok.
  494: 
  495: %% reverse merge functions
  496: rmerge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  497: 
  498:     Two = [2,1],
  499:     Six = [6,5,4,3,2,1],
  500: 
  501:     %% 2-way reversed merge
  502:     [] = lists:rmerge([], []),
  503:     Two = lists:rmerge(Two, []),
  504:     Two = lists:rmerge([], Two),
  505:     Six = lists:rmerge([5,3,1], [6,4,2]),
  506:     Six = lists:rmerge([6,4,2], [5,3,1]),
  507:     Six = lists:rmerge([3,2,1], [6,5,4]),
  508:     Six = lists:rmerge([6,5,4], [3,2,1]),
  509:     Six = lists:rmerge([4,3,2],[6,5,1]),
  510:     [7,6,5,3,1] = lists:rmerge([7,5,3,1], [6]),
  511:     [7,6,5,4,3,1] = lists:rmerge([7,5,3,1], [6,4]),
  512:     [7,6,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rmerge([7,5,3,1], [6,4,2]),
  513:     [7,5,3,2,1] = lists:rmerge([2], [7,5,3,1]),
  514:     [7,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rmerge([4,2], [7,5,3,1]),
  515:     [7,6,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rmerge([6,4,2], [7,5,3,1]),
  516: 
  517:     Nine = [9,8,7,6,5,4,3,2,1],
  518: 
  519:     %% 3-way reversed merge
  520:     [] = lists:rmerge3([], [], []),
  521:     Two = lists:rmerge3([], [], Two),
  522:     Two = lists:rmerge3([], Two, []),
  523:     Two = lists:rmerge3(Two, [], []),
  524:     Six = lists:rmerge3([], [5,3,1], [6,4,2]),
  525:     Six = lists:rmerge3([5,3,1], [], [6,4,2]),
  526:     Six = lists:rmerge3([5,3,1], [6,4,2], []),
  527:     Nine = lists:rmerge3([7,4,1],[8,5,2],[9,6,3]),
  528:     Nine = lists:rmerge3([7,4,1],[9,6,3],[8,5,2]),
  529:     Nine = lists:rmerge3([9,6,3],[7,4,1],[8,5,2]),
  530:     Nine = lists:rmerge3([6,5,4],[3,2,1],[9,8,7]),
  531:     Nine = lists:rmerge3([3,2,1],[6,5,4],[9,8,7]),
  532:     Nine = lists:rmerge3([9,8,7],[6,5,4],[3,2,1]),
  533:     Nine = lists:rmerge3([6,5,4],[9,8,7],[3,2,1]),
  534: 
  535:     ok.
  536: 
  537: sort_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  538:     [] = lists:sort([]),
  539:     [a] = lists:sort([a]),
  540:     [a,a] = lists:sort([a,a]),
  541:     [a,b] = lists:sort([a,b]),
  542:     [a,b] = lists:sort([b,a]),
  543:     [1,1] = lists:sort([1,1]),
  544:     [1,1,2,3] = lists:sort([1,1,3,2]),
  545:     [1,2,3,3] = lists:sort([3,3,1,2]),
  546:     [1,1,1,1] = lists:sort([1,1,1,1]),
  547:     [1,1,1,2,2,2,3,3,3] = lists:sort([3,3,3,2,2,2,1,1,1]),
  548:     [1,1,1,2,2,2,3,3,3] = lists:sort([1,1,1,2,2,2,3,3,3]),
  549: 
  550:     lists:foreach(fun check/1, perms([1,2,3])),
  551:     lists:foreach(fun check/1, perms([1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8])),
  552:     ok.
  553: 
  554: %% sort/1 on big randomized lists
  555: sort_rand(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  556:     ok = check(biglist(10)),
  557:     ok = check(biglist(100)),
  558:     ok = check(biglist(1000)),
  559:     ok = check(biglist(10000)),
  560:     ok.
  561: 
  562: %% sort/1 was really stable for a while - the order of equal elements
  563: %% was kept - but since the performance suffered a bit, this "feature"
  564: %% was removed.
  565: 
  566: %% sort/1 should be stable for equal terms.
  567: sort_stable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  568:     ok = check_stability(bigfunlist(10)),
  569:     ok = check_stability(bigfunlist(100)),
  570:     ok = check_stability(bigfunlist(1000)),
  571:     case erlang:system_info(modified_timing_level) of
  572: 	undefined -> ok = check_stability(bigfunlist(10000));
  573: 	_ -> ok
  574:     end,
  575:     ok.
  576: 
  577: check([]) ->
  578:     ok;
  579: check(L) ->
  580:     S = lists:sort(L),
  581:     case {length(L) == length(S), check(hd(S), tl(S))} of
  582: 	{true,ok} ->
  583: 	    ok;
  584: 	_ ->
  585: 	    io:format("~w~n", [L]),
  586: 	    erlang:error(check)
  587:     end.
  588: 
  589: check(_A, []) ->
  590:     ok;
  591: check(A, [B | L]) when A =< B ->
  592:     check(B, L);
  593: check(_A, _L) ->
  594:     no.
  595: 
  596: %% The check that sort/1 is stable is no longer used.
  597: %% Equal elements are no longer always kept in order.
  598: check_stability(L) ->
  599:     S = lists:sort(L),
  600:     LP = explicit_pid(L),
  601:     SP = explicit_pid(S),
  602:     check_sorted(1, 2, LP, SP).
  603: 
  604: explicit_pid(L) ->
  605:     lists:reverse(expl_pid(L, [])).
  606: 
  607: expl_pid([{I,F} | T], L) when is_function(F) ->
  608:     expl_pid(T, [{I,fun_pid(F)} | L]);
  609: expl_pid([], L) ->
  610:     L.
  611: 
  612: 
  613: usort_1(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  614:     [] = lists:usort([]),
  615:     [1] = lists:usort([1]),
  616:     [1] = lists:usort([1,1]),
  617:     [1] = lists:usort([1,1,1,1,1]),
  618:     [1,2] = lists:usort([1,2]),
  619:     [1,2] = lists:usort([1,2,1]),
  620:     [1,2] = lists:usort([1,2,2]),
  621:     [1,2,3] = lists:usort([1,3,2]),
  622:     [1,3] = lists:usort([3,1,3]),
  623:     [0,1,3] = lists:usort([3,1,0]),
  624:     [1,2,3] = lists:usort([3,1,2]),
  625:     [1,2] = lists:usort([2,1,1]),
  626:     [1,2] = lists:usort([2,1]),
  627:     [0,3,4,8,9] = lists:usort([3,8,9,0,9,4]),
  628: 
  629:     lists:foreach(fun ucheck/1, perms([1,2,3])),
  630:     lists:foreach(fun ucheck/1, perms([1,2,3,4,5,6,2,1])),
  631: 
  632:     ok.
  633: 
  634: umerge(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  635:     %% merge list of lists
  636:     [] = lists:umerge([]),
  637:     [] = lists:umerge([[]]),
  638:     [] = lists:umerge([[],[]]),
  639:     [] = lists:umerge([[],[],[]]),
  640:     [1] = lists:umerge([[1]]),
  641:     [1,2] = lists:umerge([[1,2],[1,2]]),
  642:     [1] = lists:umerge([[1],[],[]]),
  643:     [1] = lists:umerge([[],[1],[]]),
  644:     [1] = lists:umerge([[],[],[1]]),
  645:     [1,2] = lists:umerge([[1],[2],[]]),
  646:     [1,2] = lists:umerge([[1],[],[2]]),
  647:     [1,2] = lists:umerge([[],[1],[2]]),
  648:     [1,2,3,4,5,6] = lists:umerge([[1,2],[],[5,6],[],[3,4],[]]),
  649:     [1,2,3,4] = lists:umerge([[4],[3],[2],[1]]),
  650:     [1,2,3,4,5] = lists:umerge([[1],[2],[3],[4],[5]]),
  651:     [1,2,3,4,5,6] = lists:umerge([[1],[2],[3],[4],[5],[6]]),
  652:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9] =
  653:         lists:umerge([[1],[2],[3],[4],[5],[6],[7],[8],[9]]),
  654:     [1,2,4,6,8] = lists:umerge([[1,2],[2,4,6,8]]),
  655:     Seq = lists:seq(1,100),
  656:     true = Seq == lists:umerge(lists:map(fun(E) -> [E] end, Seq)),
  657: 
  658:     Two = [1,2],
  659:     Six = [1,2,3,4,5,6],
  660: 
  661:     %% 2-way unique merge
  662:     [] = lists:umerge([], []),
  663:     Two = lists:umerge(Two, []),
  664:     Two = lists:umerge([], Two),
  665:     Six = lists:umerge([1,3,5], [2,4,6]),
  666:     Six = lists:umerge([2,4,6], [1,3,5]),
  667:     Six = lists:umerge([1,2,3], [4,5,6]),
  668:     Six = lists:umerge([4,5,6], [1,2,3]),
  669:     Six = lists:umerge([1,2,5],[3,4,6]),
  670:     [1,2,3,5,7] = lists:umerge([1,3,5,7], [2]),
  671:     [1,2,3,4,5,7] = lists:umerge([1,3,5,7], [2,4]),
  672:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] = lists:umerge([1,3,5,7], [2,4,6]),
  673:     [1,2,3,5,7] = lists:umerge([2], [1,3,5,7]),
  674:     [1,2,3,4,5,7] = lists:umerge([2,4], [1,3,5,7]),
  675:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] = lists:umerge([2,4,6], [1,3,5,7]),
  676: 
  677:     [1,2,3,5,7] = lists:umerge([1,2,3,5,7], [2]),
  678:     [1,2,3,4,5,7] = lists:umerge([1,2,3,4,5,7], [2,4]),
  679:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] = lists:umerge([1,2,3,4,5,6,7], [2,4,6]),
  680:     [1,2,3,5,7] = lists:umerge([2], [1,2,3,5,7]),
  681:     [1,2,3,4,5,7] = lists:umerge([2,4], [1,2,3,4,5,7]),
  682:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] = lists:umerge([2,4,6], [1,2,3,4,5,6,7]),
  683: 
  684:     %% 3-way unique merge
  685:     [] = lists:umerge3([], [], []),
  686:     Two = lists:umerge3([], [], Two),
  687:     Two = lists:umerge3([], Two, []),
  688:     Two = lists:umerge3(Two, [], []),
  689:     Six = lists:umerge3([], [1,3,5], [2,4,6]),
  690:     Six = lists:umerge3([1,3,5], [], [2,4,6]),
  691:     Six = lists:umerge3([1,3,5], [2,4,6], []),
  692:     Nine = lists:umerge3([1,4,7],[2,5,8],[3,6,9]),
  693:     Nine = lists:umerge3([1,4,7],[3,6,9],[2,5,8]),
  694:     Nine = lists:umerge3([3,6,9],[1,4,7],[2,5,8]),
  695:     Nine = lists:umerge3([4,5,6],[1,2,3],[7,8,9]),
  696:     Nine = lists:umerge3([1,2,3],[4,5,6],[7,8,9]),
  697:     Nine = lists:umerge3([7,8,9],[4,5,6],[1,2,3]),
  698:     Nine = lists:umerge3([4,5,6],[7,8,9],[1,2,3]),
  699: 
  700:     [1,2,3] = lists:umerge3([1,2,3],[1,2,3],[1,2,3]),
  701:     [1,2,3,4] = lists:umerge3([2,3,4],[1,2,3],[2,3,4]),
  702:     [1,2,3] = lists:umerge3([1,2,3],[2,3],[1,2,3]),
  703:     [1,2,3,4] = lists:umerge3([2,3,4],[3,4],[1,2,3]),
  704: 
  705:     ok.
  706: 
  707: rumerge(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  708:     Two = [2,1],
  709:     Six = [6,5,4,3,2,1],
  710: 
  711:     %% 2-way reversed unique merge
  712:     [] = lists:rumerge([], []),
  713:     Two = lists:rumerge(Two, []),
  714:     Two = lists:rumerge([], Two),
  715:     Six = lists:rumerge([5,3,1], [6,4,2]),
  716:     Six = lists:rumerge([6,4,2], [5,3,1]),
  717:     Six = lists:rumerge([3,2,1], [6,5,4]),
  718:     Six = lists:rumerge([6,5,4], [3,2,1]),
  719:     Six = lists:rumerge([4,3,2],[6,5,1]),
  720:     [7,6,5,3,1] = lists:rumerge([7,5,3,1], [6]),
  721:     [7,6,5,4,3,1] = lists:rumerge([7,5,3,1], [6,4]),
  722:     [7,6,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge([7,5,3,1], [6,4,2]),
  723:     [7,5,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge([2], [7,5,3,1]),
  724:     [7,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge([4,2], [7,5,3,1]),
  725:     [7,6,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge([6,4,2], [7,5,3,1]),
  726: 
  727:     [7,6,5,3,1] = lists:rumerge([7,6,5,3,1], [6]),
  728:     [7,6,5,4,3,1] = lists:rumerge([7,6,5,4,3,1], [6,4]),
  729:     [7,6,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge([7,6,5,4,3,2,1], [6,4,2]),
  730:     [7,5,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge([2], [7,5,3,2,1]),
  731:     [7,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge([4,2], [7,5,4,3,2,1]),
  732:     [7,6,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge([6,4,2], [7,6,5,4,3,2,1]),
  733: 
  734:     Nine = [9,8,7,6,5,4,3,2,1],
  735: 
  736:     %% 3-way reversed unique merge
  737:     [] = lists:rumerge3([], [], []),
  738:     Two = lists:rumerge3([], [], Two),
  739:     Two = lists:rumerge3([], Two, []),
  740:     Two = lists:rumerge3(Two, [], []),
  741:     Six = lists:rumerge3([], [5,3,1], [6,4,2]),
  742:     Six = lists:rumerge3([5,3,1], [], [6,4,2]),
  743:     Six = lists:rumerge3([5,3,1], [6,4,2], []),
  744:     Nine = lists:rumerge3([7,4,1],[8,5,2],[9,6,3]),
  745:     Nine = lists:rumerge3([7,4,1],[9,6,3],[8,5,2]),
  746:     Nine = lists:rumerge3([9,6,3],[7,4,1],[8,5,2]),
  747:     Nine = lists:rumerge3([6,5,4],[3,2,1],[9,8,7]),
  748:     Nine = lists:rumerge3([3,2,1],[6,5,4],[9,8,7]),
  749:     Nine = lists:rumerge3([9,8,7],[6,5,4],[3,2,1]),
  750:     Nine = lists:rumerge3([6,5,4],[9,8,7],[3,2,1]),
  751: 
  752:     [3,2,1] = lists:rumerge3([3,2,1],[3,2,1],[3,2,1]),
  753:     [4,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge3([4,3,2],[3,2,1],[3,2,1]),
  754:     [5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge3([4,3,2],[5,4,3,2],[5,4,3,2,1]),
  755:     [6,5,4,3,2] = lists:rumerge3([4,3,2],[5,4,3,2],[6,5,4,3]),
  756: 
  757:     L1 = [c,d,e],
  758:     L2 = [b,c,d],
  759:     true =
  760: 	lists:umerge(L1, L2) == 
  761: 	lists:reverse(lists:rumerge(lists:reverse(L1), lists:reverse(L2))),
  762:     ok.
  763: 
  764: %% usort/1 on big randomized lists.
  765: usort_rand(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  766:     ok = ucheck(biglist(10)),
  767:     ok = ucheck(biglist(100)),
  768:     ok = ucheck(biglist(1000)),
  769:     ok = ucheck(biglist(10000)),
  770: 
  771:     ok = ucheck(ubiglist(10)),
  772:     ok = ucheck(ubiglist(100)),
  773:     ok = ucheck(ubiglist(1000)),
  774:     ok = ucheck(ubiglist(10000)),
  775:     ok.
  776: 
  777: %% usort/1 should keep the first duplicate.
  778: usort_stable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  779:     ok = ucheck_stability(bigfunlist(3)),
  780:     ok = ucheck_stability(bigfunlist(10)),
  781:     ok = ucheck_stability(bigfunlist(100)),
  782:     ok = ucheck_stability(bigfunlist(1000)),
  783:     case erlang:system_info(modified_timing_level) of
  784: 	undefined -> ok = ucheck_stability(bigfunlist(10000));
  785: 	_ -> ok
  786:     end,
  787:     ok.
  788: 
  789: ucheck([]) ->
  790:     ok;
  791: ucheck(L) ->
  792:     S = lists:usort(L),
  793:     case ucheck(hd(S), tl(S)) of
  794: 	ok ->
  795: 	    ok;
  796: 	_ ->
  797: 	    io:format("~w~n", [L]),
  798: 	    erlang:error(ucheck)
  799:     end.
  800: 
  801: ucheck(_A, []) ->
  802:     ok;
  803: ucheck(A, [B | L]) when A < B ->
  804:     ucheck(B, L);
  805: ucheck(_A, _L) ->
  806:     no.
  807: 
  808: %% Check that usort/1 is stable and correct relative ukeysort/2.
  809: ucheck_stability(L) ->
  810:     S = no_dups(lsort(L)),
  811:     U = lists:usort(L),
  812:     check_stab(L, U, S, "usort/1", "ukeysort/2").
  813: 
  814: 
  815: %% Key merge two lists.
  816: keymerge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  817: 
  818:     Two = [{1,a},{2,b}],
  819:     Six = [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{6,f}],
  820: 
  821:     %% 2-way keymerge
  822:     [] = lists:keymerge(1, [], []),
  823:     Two = lists:keymerge(1, Two, []),
  824:     Two = lists:keymerge(1, [], Two),
  825:     Six = lists:keymerge(1, [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e}], [{2,b},{4,d},{6,f}]),
  826:     Six = lists:keymerge(1, [{2,b},{4,d},{6,f}], [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e}]),
  827:     Six = lists:keymerge(1, [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c}], [{4,d},{5,e},{6,f}]),
  828:     Six = lists:keymerge(1, [{4,d},{5,e},{6,f}], [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c}]),
  829:     Six = lists:keymerge(1, [{1,a},{2,b},{5,e}],[{3,c},{4,d},{6,f}]),
  830:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}] =
  831: 	lists:keymerge(1, [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}], [{2,b}]),
  832:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{7,g}] =
  833: 	lists:keymerge(1, [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}], [{2,b},{4,d}]),
  834:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{6,f},{7,g}] =
  835: 	lists:keymerge(1, [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}], [{2,b},{4,d},{6,f}]),
  836:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}] =
  837: 	lists:keymerge(1, [{2,b}], [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}]),
  838:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{7,g}] =
  839: 	lists:keymerge(1, [{2,b},{4,d}], [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}]),
  840:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{6,f},{7,g}] =
  841: 	lists:keymerge(1, [{2,b},{4,d},{6,f}], [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}]),
  842: 
  843:     [{b,2},{c,11},{c,12},{c,21},{c,22},{e,5}] =
  844: 	lists:keymerge(1,[{c,11},{c,12},{e,5}], [{b,2},{c,21},{c,22}]),
  845: 
  846:     ok.
  847: 
  848: %% Reverse key merge two lists.
  849: rkeymerge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  850: 
  851:     Two = [{2,b},{1,a}],
  852:     Six = [{6,f},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}],
  853: 
  854:     %% 2-way reversed keymerge
  855:     [] = lists:rkeymerge(1, [], []),
  856:     Two = lists:rkeymerge(1, Two, []),
  857:     Two = lists:rkeymerge(1, [], Two),
  858:     Six = lists:rkeymerge(1, [{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}], [{6,f},{4,d},{2,b}]),
  859:     Six = lists:rkeymerge(1, [{6,f},{4,d},{2,b}], [{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}]),
  860:     Six = lists:rkeymerge(1, [{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}], [{6,f},{5,e},{4,d}]),
  861:     Six = lists:rkeymerge(1, [{6,f},{5,e},{4,d}], [{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}]),
  862:     Six = lists:rkeymerge(1, [{4,d},{3,c},{2,b}],[{6,f},{5,e},{1,a}]),
  863:     [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}] =
  864: 	lists:rkeymerge(1, [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}], [{6,f}]),
  865:     [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{1,a}] =
  866: 	lists:rkeymerge(1, [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}], [{6,f},{4,d}]),
  867:     [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}] =
  868: 	lists:rkeymerge(1, [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}], [{6,f},{4,d},{2,b}]),
  869:     [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}] =
  870: 	lists:rkeymerge(1, [{2,b}], [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}]),
  871:     [{7,g},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}] =
  872: 	lists:rkeymerge(1, [{4,d},{2,b}], [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}]),
  873:     [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}] =
  874: 	lists:rkeymerge(1, [{6,f},{4,d},{2,b}], [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}]),
  875: 
  876:     L1 = [{c,11},{c,12},{e,5}],
  877:     L2 = [{b,2},{c,21},{c,22}],
  878:     true =
  879: 	lists:keymerge(1, L1, L2) == 
  880: 	lists:reverse(lists:rkeymerge(1,lists:reverse(L1), 
  881: 				      lists:reverse(L2))),
  882: 
  883:     ok.
  884: 
  885: keysort_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  886:     ok = keysort_check(1, [], []),
  887:     ok = keysort_check(1, [{a,b}], [{a,b}]),
  888:     ok = keysort_check(1, [{a,b},{a,b}], [{a,b},{a,b}]),
  889:     ok = keysort_check(1, [{a,b},{b,c}], [{a,b},{b,c}]),
  890:     ok = keysort_check(1, [{b,c},{a,b}], [{a,b},{b,c}]),
  891:     ok = keysort_check(1,
  892: 		       [{1,e},{3,f},{2,y},{0,z},{x,14}],
  893: 		       [{0,z},{1,e},{2,y},{3,f},{x,14}]),
  894:     ok = keysort_check(1,
  895: 		       [{1,a},{1,a},{1,a},{1,a}],
  896: 		       [{1,a},{1,a},{1,a},{1,a}]),
  897: 
  898:     [{b,1},{c,1}] = lists:keysort(1, [{c,1},{b,1}]),
  899:     [{a,0},{b,2},{c,3},{d,4}] =
  900: 	lists:keysort(1, [{d,4},{c,3},{b,2},{a,0}]),
  901:     [{a,0},{b,1},{b,2},{c,1}] =
  902: 	lists:keysort(1, [{c,1},{b,1},{b,2},{a,0}]),
  903:     [{a,0},{b,1},{b,2},{c,1},{d,4}] =
  904: 	lists:keysort(1, [{c,1},{b,1},{b,2},{a,0},{d,4}]),
  905: 
  906:     SFun = fun(L) -> fun(X) -> keysort_check(1, X, L) end end,
  907:     L1 = [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c}],
  908:     lists:foreach(SFun(L1), perms(L1)),
  909:     L2 = [{1,a},{1,a},{2,b}],
  910:     lists:foreach(SFun(L2), perms(L2)),
  911:     L3 = [{1,a},{1,a},{1,a},{2,b}],
  912:     lists:foreach(SFun(L3), perms(L3)),
  913:     L4 = [{a,1},{a,1},{b,2},{b,2},{c,3},{d,4},{e,5},{f,6}],
  914:     lists:foreach(SFun(L4), perms(L4)),
  915: 
  916:     ok.
  917: 
  918: %% keysort should be stable
  919: keysort_stable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  920:     ok = keysort_check(1, [{1,b},{1,c}], [{1,b},{1,c}]),
  921:     ok = keysort_check(1, [{1,c},{1,b}], [{1,c},{1,b}]),
  922:     ok = keysort_check(1,
  923: 		       [{1,c},{1,b},{2,x},{3,p},{2,a}],
  924: 		       [{1,c},{1,b},{2,x},{2,a},{3,p}]),
  925:     ok = keysort_check(1,
  926: 		       [{1,a},{1,b},{1,a},{1,a}],
  927: 		       [{1,a},{1,b},{1,a},{1,a}]),
  928:     ok.
  929: 
  930: %% keysort should exit when given bad arguments
  931: keysort_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  932:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:keysort(0, [{1,b},{1,c}])),
  933:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:keysort(3, [{1,b},{1,c}])),
  934:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:keysort(1.5, [{1,b},{1,c}])),
  935:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:keysort(x, [{1,b},{1,c}])),
  936:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:keysort(x, [])),
  937:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:keysort(x, [{1,b}])),
  938:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:keysort(1, [a,b])),
  939:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:keysort(1, [{1,b} | {1,c}])),
  940:     ok.
  941: 
  942: %% keysort with other key than first element
  943: keysort_i(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  944:     ok = keysort_check(2, [{a,2},{b,1},{c,3}], [{b,1},{a,2},{c,3}]),
  945:     ok.
  946: 
  947: %% keysort on big randomized lists
  948: keysort_rand(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  949:     ok = keysort_check3(1, biglist(10)),
  950:     ok = keysort_check3(1, biglist(100)),
  951:     ok = keysort_check3(1, biglist(1000)),
  952:     ok = keysort_check3(1, biglist(10000)),
  953: 
  954:     ok = keysort_check3(2, biglist(10)),
  955:     ok = keysort_check3(2, biglist(100)),
  956:     ok = keysort_check3(2, biglist(1000)),
  957:     ok = keysort_check3(2, biglist(10000)),
  958:     ok.
  959: 
  960: %%% Keysort a list, check that the returned list is what we expected,
  961: %%% and that it is actually sorted.
  962: keysort_check(I, Input, Expected) ->
  963:     Expected = lists:keysort(I, Input),
  964:     check_sorted(I, Input, Expected).
  965: 
  966: keysort_check3(I, Input) ->
  967:     check_sorted(I, 3, Input, lists:keysort(I, Input)).
  968: 
  969: check_sorted(I, Input, L) ->
  970:     check_sorted(I, I, Input, L).
  971: 
  972: %%% Check that a list is keysorted by element I. Elements comparing equal
  973: %%% should be sorted according to element J.
  974: check_sorted(_I, _J, _Input, []) ->
  975:     ok;
  976: check_sorted(I, J, Input, [A | Rest]) ->
  977:     case catch check_sorted1(I, J, A, Rest) of
  978: 	{'EXIT', _} ->
  979: 	    io:format("~w~n", [Input]),
  980: 	    erlang:error(check_sorted);
  981: 	Reply ->
  982: 	    Reply
  983:     end.
  984: 
  985: check_sorted1(_I, _J, _A, []) ->
  986:     ok;
  987: check_sorted1(I, J, A, [B | Rest]) ->
  988:     ok = keycompare(I, J, A, B),
  989:     check_sorted1(I, J, B, Rest).
  990: 
  991: keycompare(I, _J, A, B) when element(I, A) < element(I, B) ->
  992:     ok;
  993: keycompare(I, J, A, B) when element(I, A) == element(I, B), 
  994: 			    element(J, A) =< element(J, B) ->
  995:     ok.
  996: 
  997: 
  998: %% Merge two lists while removing duplicates.
  999: ukeymerge(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1000: 
 1001:     Two = [{1,a},{2,b}],
 1002:     Six = [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{6,f}],
 1003: 
 1004:     %% 2-way unique keymerge
 1005:     [] = lists:ukeymerge(1, [], []),
 1006:     Two = lists:ukeymerge(1, Two, []),
 1007:     Two = lists:ukeymerge(1, [], Two),
 1008:     [] = lists:ukeymerge(1, [], []),
 1009:     Two = lists:ukeymerge(1, Two, []),
 1010:     Two = lists:ukeymerge(1, [], Two),
 1011:     Six = lists:ukeymerge(1, [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e}], [{2,b},{4,d},{6,f}]),
 1012:     Six = lists:ukeymerge(1, [{2,b},{4,d},{6,f}], [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e}]),
 1013:     Six = lists:ukeymerge(1, [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c}], [{4,d},{5,e},{6,f}]),
 1014:     Six = lists:ukeymerge(1, [{4,d},{5,e},{6,f}], [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c}]),
 1015:     Six = lists:ukeymerge(1, [{1,a},{2,b},{5,e}],[{3,c},{4,d},{6,f}]),
 1016:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}] =
 1017: 	lists:ukeymerge(1, [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}], [{2,b}]),
 1018:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{7,g}] =
 1019: 	lists:ukeymerge(1, [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}], [{2,b},{4,d}]),
 1020:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{6,f},{7,g}] =
 1021: 	lists:ukeymerge(1, [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}], [{2,b},{4,d},{6,f}]),
 1022:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}] =
 1023: 	lists:ukeymerge(1, [{2,b}], [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}]),
 1024:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{7,g}] =
 1025: 	lists:ukeymerge(1, [{2,b},{4,d}], [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}]),
 1026:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{6,f},{7,g}] =
 1027: 	lists:ukeymerge(1, [{2,b},{4,d},{6,f}], [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}]),
 1028: 
 1029:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}] =
 1030: 	lists:ukeymerge(1, [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}], [{2,b}]),
 1031:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{7,g}] =
 1032: 	lists:ukeymerge(1, [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{7,g}], 
 1033: 			[{2,b},{4,d}]),
 1034:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{6,f},{7,g}] =
 1035: 	lists:ukeymerge(1, [{1,a},{3,c},{5,e},{6,f},{7,g}], 
 1036: 			[{2,b},{4,d},{6,f}]),
 1037:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}] =
 1038: 	lists:ukeymerge(1, [{2,b}], [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{5,e},{7,g}]),
 1039:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{7,g}] =
 1040: 	lists:ukeymerge(1, [{2,b},{4,d}], 
 1041: 			[{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{7,g}]),
 1042:     [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{6,f},{7,g}] =
 1043: 	lists:ukeymerge(1, [{2,b},{4,d},{6,f}], 
 1044: 			[{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{6,f},{7,g}]),
 1045: 
 1046:     L1 = [{a,1},{a,3},{a,5},{a,7}],
 1047:     L2 = [{b,1},{b,3},{b,5},{b,7}],
 1048:     L1 = lists:ukeymerge(2, L1, L2),
 1049: 
 1050:     ok.
 1051: 
 1052: %% Reverse merge two lists while removing duplicates.
 1053: rukeymerge(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1054: 
 1055:     Two = [{2,b},{1,a}],
 1056:     Six = [{6,f},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}],
 1057: 
 1058:     %% 2-way reversed unique keymerge
 1059:     [] = lists:rukeymerge(1, [], []),
 1060:     Two = lists:rukeymerge(1, Two, []),
 1061:     Two = lists:rukeymerge(1, [], Two),
 1062:     Six = lists:rukeymerge(1, [{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}], [{6,f},{4,d},{2,b}]),
 1063:     Six = lists:rukeymerge(1, [{6,f},{4,d},{2,b}], [{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}]),
 1064:     Six = lists:rukeymerge(1, [{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}], [{6,f},{5,e},{4,d}]),
 1065:     Six = lists:rukeymerge(1, [{6,f},{5,e},{4,d}], [{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}]),
 1066:     Six = lists:rukeymerge(1, [{4,d},{3,c},{2,b}],[{6,f},{5,e},{1,a}]),
 1067:     [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}] =
 1068: 	lists:rukeymerge(1, [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}], [{6,f}]),
 1069:     [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{1,a}] =
 1070: 	lists:rukeymerge(1, [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}], [{6,f},{4,d}]),
 1071:     [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}] =
 1072: 	lists:rukeymerge(1, [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}], [{6,f},{4,d},{2,b}]),
 1073:     [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}] =
 1074: 	lists:rukeymerge(1, [{2,b}], [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}]),
 1075:     [{7,g},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}] =
 1076: 	lists:rukeymerge(1, [{4,d},{2,b}], [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}]),
 1077:     [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}] =
 1078: 	lists:rukeymerge(1, [{6,f},{4,d},{2,b}], [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}]),
 1079: 
 1080:     [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}] =
 1081: 	lists:rukeymerge(1, [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{3,c},{1,a}], [{6,f}]),
 1082:     [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{1,a}] =
 1083: 	lists:rukeymerge(1, [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{1,a}], 
 1084: 			 [{6,f},{4,d}]),
 1085:     [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}] =
 1086: 	lists:rukeymerge(1, [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}], 
 1087: 			 [{6,f},{4,d},{2,b}]),
 1088:     [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}] =
 1089: 	lists:rukeymerge(1, [{2,b}], [{7,g},{5,e},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}]),
 1090:     [{7,g},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}] =
 1091: 	lists:rukeymerge(1, [{4,d},{2,b}], 
 1092: 			 [{7,g},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}]),
 1093:     [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}] =
 1094: 	lists:rukeymerge(1, [{6,f},{4,d},{2,b}], 
 1095: 			 [{7,g},{6,f},{5,e},{4,d},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a}]),
 1096: 
 1097:     L1 = [{a,1},{a,3},{a,5},{a,7}],
 1098:     L2 = [{b,1},{b,3},{b,5},{b,7}],
 1099:     true =
 1100: 	lists:ukeymerge(2, L1, L2) == 
 1101: 	lists:reverse(lists:rukeymerge(2, lists:reverse(L1), 
 1102: 				       lists:reverse(L2))),
 1103: 
 1104:     ok.
 1105: 
 1106: ukeysort_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1107:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, [], []),
 1108:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, [{a,b}], [{a,b}]),
 1109:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, [{a,b},{a,b}], [{a,b}]),
 1110:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, [{a,b},{b,c}], [{a,b},{b,c}]),
 1111:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, [{b,c},{a,b}], [{a,b},{b,c}]),
 1112:     ok = ukeysort_check(1,
 1113: 			[{1,e},{3,f},{2,y},{0,z},{x,14}],
 1114: 			[{0,z},{1,e},{2,y},{3,f},{x,14}]),
 1115:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, [{1,a},{1,a},{1,a},{1,a}], [{1,a}]),
 1116: 
 1117:     L1 = [{1,a},{1,b},{1,a}],
 1118:     L1u = lists:ukeysort(1, L1),
 1119:     L2 = [{1,a},{1,b},{1,a}],
 1120:     L2u = lists:ukeysort(1, L2),
 1121:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, lists:keymerge(1, L1, L2),
 1122: 			lists:ukeymerge(1, L1u, L2u)),
 1123:     L3 = [{1,a},{1,b},{1,a},{2,a}],
 1124:     L3u = lists:ukeysort(1, L3),
 1125:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, lists:keymerge(1, L3, L2),
 1126: 			lists:ukeymerge(1, L3u, L2u)),
 1127:     L4 = [{1,b},{1,a}],
 1128:     L4u = lists:ukeysort(1, L4),
 1129:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, lists:keymerge(1, L1, L4),
 1130: 			lists:ukeymerge(1, L1u, L4u)),
 1131:     L5 = [{1,a},{1,b},{1,a},{2,a}],
 1132:     L5u = lists:ukeysort(1, L5),
 1133:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, lists:keymerge(1, [], L5),
 1134: 			lists:ukeymerge(1, [], L5u)),
 1135:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, lists:keymerge(1, L5, []),
 1136: 			lists:ukeymerge(1, L5u, [])),
 1137:     L6 = [{3,a}],
 1138:     L6u = lists:ukeysort(1, L6),
 1139:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, lists:keymerge(1, L5, L6),
 1140: 			lists:ukeymerge(1, L5u, L6u)),
 1141: 
 1142:     [{b,1},{c,1}] = lists:ukeysort(1, [{c,1},{c,1},{c,1},{c,1},{b,1}]),
 1143:     [{a,0},{b,2},{c,3},{d,4}] =
 1144: 	lists:ukeysort(1, [{d,4},{c,3},{b,2},{b,2},{a,0}]),
 1145:     [{a,0},{b,1},{c,1}] =
 1146: 	lists:ukeysort(1, [{c,1},{b,1},{b,1},{b,2},{b,2},{a,0}]),
 1147:     [{a,0},{b,1},{c,1},{d,4}] =
 1148: 	lists:ukeysort(1, [{c,1},{b,1},{b,2},{a,0},{a,0},{d,4},{d,4}]),
 1149: 
 1150:     SFun = fun(L) -> fun(X) -> ukeysort_check(2, X, L) end end,
 1151:     PL = [{a,1},{b,2},{c,3},{d,4},{e,5},{f,6}],
 1152:     Ps = perms([{a,1},{b,2},{c,3},{d,4},{e,5},{f,6},{b,2},{a,1}]),
 1153:     lists:foreach(SFun(PL), Ps),
 1154: 
 1155:     M1L = [{1,a},{1,a},{2,b}],
 1156:     M1s = [{1,a},{2,b}],
 1157:     lists:foreach(SFun(M1s), perms(M1L)),
 1158:     M2L = [{1,a},{2,b},{2,b}],
 1159:     M2s = [{1,a},{2,b}],
 1160:     lists:foreach(SFun(M2s), perms(M2L)),
 1161:     M3 = [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c}],
 1162:     lists:foreach(SFun(M3), perms(M3)),
 1163: 
 1164:     ok.
 1165: 
 1166: %% ukeysort should keep the first duplicate.
 1167: ukeysort_stable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1168:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, [{1,b},{1,c}], [{1,b}]),
 1169:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, [{1,c},{1,b}], [{1,c}]),
 1170:     ok = ukeysort_check(1,
 1171: 			[{1,c},{1,b},{2,x},{3,p},{2,a}],
 1172: 			[{1,c},{2,x},{3,p}]),
 1173: 
 1174:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, [{1,a},{1,b},{1,b}], [{1,a}]),
 1175:     ok = ukeysort_check(1, [{2,a},{1,b},{2,a}], [{1,b},{2,a}]),
 1176: 
 1177:     ok = ukeysort_check_stability(bigfunlist(3)),
 1178:     ok = ukeysort_check_stability(bigfunlist(10)),
 1179:     ok = ukeysort_check_stability(bigfunlist(100)),
 1180:     ok = ukeysort_check_stability(bigfunlist(1000)),
 1181:     case erlang:system_info(modified_timing_level) of
 1182: 	undefined -> ok = ukeysort_check_stability(bigfunlist(10000));
 1183: 	_ -> ok
 1184:     end,
 1185:     ok.
 1186: 
 1187: %% ukeysort should exit when given bad arguments.
 1188: ukeysort_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1189:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:ukeysort(0, [{1,b},{1,c}])),
 1190:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:ukeysort(3, [{1,b},{1,c}])),
 1191:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:ukeysort(1.5, [{1,b},{1,c}])),
 1192:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:ukeysort(x, [{1,b},{1,c}])),
 1193:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:ukeysort(x, [])),
 1194:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:ukeysort(x, [{1,b}])),
 1195:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:ukeysort(1, [a,b])),
 1196:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:ukeysort(1, [{1,b} | {1,c}])),
 1197:     ok.
 1198: 
 1199: %% ukeysort with other key than first element.
 1200: ukeysort_i(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1201:     ok = ukeysort_check(2, [{a,2},{b,1},{c,3}], [{b,1},{a,2},{c,3}]),
 1202:     ok.
 1203: 
 1204: %% ukeysort on big randomized lists.
 1205: ukeysort_rand(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1206:     ok = ukeysort_check3(2, biglist(10)),
 1207:     ok = ukeysort_check3(2, biglist(100)),
 1208:     ok = ukeysort_check3(2, biglist(1000)),
 1209:     ok = ukeysort_check3(2, biglist(10000)),
 1210: 
 1211:     ok = gen_ukeysort_check(1, ubiglist(10)),
 1212:     ok = gen_ukeysort_check(1, ubiglist(100)),
 1213:     ok = gen_ukeysort_check(1, ubiglist(1000)),
 1214:     ok = gen_ukeysort_check(1, ubiglist(10000)),
 1215:     ok.
 1216: 
 1217: %% Check that ukeysort/2 is stable and correct relative keysort/2.
 1218: %% (this is not affected by the fact that keysort/2 is no longer really 
 1219: %%  stable; ucheck_stability/1 checks ukeysort/2 (and usort/1, of course))
 1220: gen_ukeysort_check(I, Input) ->
 1221:     U = lists:ukeysort(I, Input),
 1222:     S = lists:keysort(I, Input),
 1223:     case U == no_dups_keys(S, I) of
 1224: 	true ->
 1225: 	    ok;
 1226: 	false ->
 1227: 	    io:format("~w~n", [Input]),
 1228: 	    erlang:error(gen_ukeysort_check)
 1229:     end.
 1230: 
 1231: %% Used for checking that the first copy is kept.
 1232: ukeysort_check_stability(L) ->
 1233:     I = 1,
 1234:     U = lists:ukeysort(I, L),
 1235:     S = no_dups_keys(lkeysort(I, L), I),
 1236:     check_stab(L, U, S, "ukeysort/2", "usort/2").
 1237: 
 1238: %%% Uniquely keysort a list, check that the returned list is what we
 1239: %%% expected, and that it is actually sorted.
 1240: ukeysort_check(I, Input, Expected) ->
 1241:     Expected = lists:ukeysort(I, Input),
 1242:     ucheck_sorted(I, Input, Expected).
 1243: 
 1244: ukeysort_check3(I, Input) ->
 1245:     ucheck_sorted(I, 3, Input, lists:ukeysort(I, Input)).
 1246: 
 1247: ucheck_sorted(I, Input, L) ->
 1248:     ucheck_sorted(I, I, Input, L).
 1249: 
 1250: %%% Check that a list is ukeysorted by element I. Elements comparing
 1251: %%% equal should be sorted according to element J.
 1252: ucheck_sorted(_I, _J, _Input, []) ->
 1253:     ok;
 1254: ucheck_sorted(I, J, Input, [A | Rest]) ->
 1255:     case catch ucheck_sorted1(I, J, A, Rest) of
 1256: 	{'EXIT', _} ->
 1257: 	    io:format("~w~n", [Input]),
 1258: 	    erlang:error(ucheck_sorted);
 1259: 	Reply ->
 1260: 	    Reply
 1261:     end.
 1262: 
 1263: ucheck_sorted1(_I, _J, _A, []) ->
 1264:     ok;
 1265: ucheck_sorted1(I, J, A, [B | Rest]) ->
 1266:     ok = ukeycompare(I, J, A, B),
 1267:     ucheck_sorted1(I, J, B, Rest).
 1268: 
 1269: ukeycompare(I, _J, A, B) when element(I, A) < element(I, B) ->
 1270:     ok;
 1271: ukeycompare(I, J, A, B) when A =/= B,
 1272: 			     element(I, A) == element(I, B), 
 1273: 			     element(J, A) =< element(J, B) ->
 1274:     ok.
 1275: 
 1276: 
 1277: 
 1278: %% Merge two lists using a fun.
 1279: funmerge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1280: 
 1281:     Two = [1,2],
 1282:     Six = [1,2,3,4,5,6],
 1283:     F = fun(X, Y) -> X =< Y end,
 1284: 
 1285:     %% 2-way merge
 1286:     [] = lists:merge(F, [], []),
 1287:     Two = lists:merge(F, Two, []),
 1288:     Two = lists:merge(F, [], Two),
 1289:     Six = lists:merge(F, [1,3,5], [2,4,6]),
 1290:     Six = lists:merge(F, [2,4,6], [1,3,5]),
 1291:     Six = lists:merge(F, [1,2,3], [4,5,6]),
 1292:     Six = lists:merge(F, [4,5,6], [1,2,3]),
 1293:     Six = lists:merge(F, [1,2,5],[3,4,6]),
 1294:     [1,2,3,5,7] = lists:merge(F, [1,3,5,7], [2]),
 1295:     [1,2,3,4,5,7] = lists:merge(F, [1,3,5,7], [2,4]),
 1296:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] = lists:merge(F, [1,3,5,7], [2,4,6]),
 1297:     [1,2,3,5,7] = lists:merge(F, [2], [1,3,5,7]),
 1298:     [1,2,3,4,5,7] = lists:merge(F, [2,4], [1,3,5,7]),
 1299:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] = lists:merge(F, [2,4,6], [1,3,5,7]),
 1300: 
 1301:     F2 = fun(X,Y) -> element(1,X) =< element(1,Y) end,
 1302:     [{b,2},{c,11},{c,12},{c,21},{c,22},{e,5}] =
 1303: 	lists:merge(F2,[{c,11},{c,12},{e,5}], [{b,2},{c,21},{c,22}]),
 1304: 
 1305:     ok.
 1306: 
 1307: %% Reverse merge two lists using a fun.
 1308: rfunmerge(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1309: 
 1310:     Two = [2,1],
 1311:     Six = [6,5,4,3,2,1],
 1312:     F = fun(X, Y) -> X =< Y end,
 1313: 
 1314:     %% 2-way reversed merge
 1315:     [] = lists:rmerge(F, [], []),
 1316:     Two = lists:rmerge(F, Two, []),
 1317:     Two = lists:rmerge(F, [], Two),
 1318:     Six = lists:rmerge(F, [5,3,1], [6,4,2]),
 1319:     Six = lists:rmerge(F, [6,4,2], [5,3,1]),
 1320:     Six = lists:rmerge(F, [3,2,1], [6,5,4]),
 1321:     Six = lists:rmerge(F, [6,5,4], [3,2,1]),
 1322:     Six = lists:rmerge(F, [4,3,2],[6,5,1]),
 1323:     [7,6,5,3,1] = lists:rmerge(F, [7,5,3,1], [6]),
 1324:     [7,6,5,4,3,1] = lists:rmerge(F, [7,5,3,1], [6,4]),
 1325:     [7,6,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rmerge(F, [7,5,3,1], [6,4,2]),
 1326:     [7,5,3,2,1] = lists:rmerge(F, [2], [7,5,3,1]),
 1327:     [7,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rmerge(F, [4,2], [7,5,3,1]),
 1328:     [7,6,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rmerge(F, [6,4,2], [7,5,3,1]),
 1329: 
 1330:     F2 = fun(X,Y) -> element(1,X) =< element(1,Y) end,
 1331:     L1 = [{c,11},{c,12},{e,5}],
 1332:     L2 = [{b,2},{c,21},{c,22}],
 1333:     true =
 1334: 	lists:merge(F2, L1, L2) == 
 1335: 	lists:reverse(lists:rmerge(F2,lists:reverse(L1), lists:reverse(L2))),
 1336: 
 1337:     ok.
 1338: 
 1339: 
 1340: funsort_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1341:     ok = funsort_check(1, [], []),
 1342:     ok = funsort_check(1, [{a,b}], [{a,b}]),
 1343:     ok = funsort_check(1, [{a,b},{a,b}], [{a,b},{a,b}]),
 1344:     ok = funsort_check(1, [{a,b},{b,c}], [{a,b},{b,c}]),
 1345:     ok = funsort_check(1, [{b,c},{a,b}], [{a,b},{b,c}]),
 1346:     ok = funsort_check(1,
 1347: 		       [{1,e},{3,f},{2,y},{0,z},{x,14}],
 1348: 		       [{0,z},{1,e},{2,y},{3,f},{x,14}]),
 1349:     F = funsort_fun(1),
 1350: 
 1351:     [{b,1},{c,1}] = lists:sort(F, [{c,1},{b,1}]),
 1352:     [{a,0},{b,2},{c,3},{d,4}] =
 1353: 	lists:sort(F, [{d,4},{c,3},{b,2},{a,0}]),
 1354:     [{a,0},{b,1},{b,2},{c,1}] =
 1355: 	lists:sort(F, [{c,1},{b,1},{b,2},{a,0}]),
 1356:     [{a,0},{b,1},{b,2},{c,1},{d,4}] =
 1357: 	lists:sort(F, [{c,1},{b,1},{b,2},{a,0},{d,4}]),
 1358: 
 1359:     SFun = fun(L) -> fun(X) -> funsort_check(1, X, L) end end,
 1360:     L1 = [{1,a},{1,a},{2,b},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{6,f}],
 1361:     lists:foreach(SFun(L1), perms(L1)),
 1362: 
 1363:     ok.
 1364: 
 1365: %% sort/2 should be stable.
 1366: funsort_stable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1367:     ok = funsort_check(1, [{1,b},{1,c}], [{1,b},{1,c}]),
 1368:     ok = funsort_check(1, [{1,c},{1,b}], [{1,c},{1,b}]),
 1369:     ok = funsort_check(1,
 1370: 		       [{1,c},{1,b},{2,x},{3,p},{2,a}],
 1371: 		       [{1,c},{1,b},{2,x},{2,a},{3,p}]),
 1372:     ok.
 1373: 
 1374: %% sort/2 should exit when given bad arguments.
 1375: funsort_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1376:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:sort(1, [{1,b} , {1,c}])),
 1377:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:sort(fun(X,Y) -> X =< Y end,
 1378: 				    [{1,b} | {1,c}])),
 1379:     ok.
 1380: 
 1381: %% sort/2 on big randomized lists.
 1382: funsort_rand(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1383:     ok = funsort_check3(1, biglist(10)),
 1384:     ok = funsort_check3(1, biglist(100)),
 1385:     ok = funsort_check3(1, biglist(1000)),
 1386:     ok = funsort_check3(1, biglist(10000)),
 1387:     ok.
 1388: 
 1389: %% Do a keysort
 1390: funsort(I, L) ->
 1391:     lists:sort(funsort_fun(I), L).
 1392: 
 1393: funsort_check3(I, Input) ->
 1394:     check_sorted(I, 3, Input, funsort(I, Input)).
 1395: 
 1396: %%% Keysort a list, check that the returned list is what we expected,
 1397: %%% and that it is actually sorted.
 1398: funsort_check(I, Input, Expected) ->
 1399:     Expected = funsort(I, Input),
 1400:     check_sorted(I, Input, Expected).
 1401: 
 1402: 
 1403: %% Merge two lists while removing duplicates using a fun.
 1404: ufunmerge(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1405: 
 1406:     Two = [1,2],
 1407:     Six = [1,2,3,4,5,6],
 1408:     F = fun(X, Y) -> X =< Y end,
 1409: 
 1410:     %% 2-way unique merge
 1411:     [] = lists:umerge(F, [], []),
 1412:     Two = lists:umerge(F, Two, []),
 1413:     Two = lists:umerge(F, [], Two),
 1414:     Six = lists:umerge(F, [1,3,5], [2,4,6]),
 1415:     Six = lists:umerge(F, [2,4,6], [1,3,5]),
 1416:     Six = lists:umerge(F, [1,2,3], [4,5,6]),
 1417:     Six = lists:umerge(F, [4,5,6], [1,2,3]),
 1418:     Six = lists:umerge(F, [1,2,5],[3,4,6]),
 1419:     [1,2,3,5,7] = lists:umerge(F, [1,3,5,7], [2]),
 1420:     [1,2,3,4,5,7] = lists:umerge(F, [1,3,5,7], [2,4]),
 1421:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] = lists:umerge(F, [1,3,5,7], [2,4,6]),
 1422:     [1,2,3,5,7] = lists:umerge(F, [2], [1,3,5,7]),
 1423:     [1,2,3,4,5,7] = lists:umerge(F, [2,4], [1,3,5,7]),
 1424:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] = lists:umerge(F, [2,4,6], [1,3,5,7]),
 1425: 
 1426:     [1,2,3,5,7] = lists:umerge(F, [1,2,3,5,7], [2]),
 1427:     [1,2,3,4,5,7] = lists:umerge(F, [1,2,3,4,5,7], [2,4]),
 1428:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] = lists:umerge(F, [1,3,5,6,7], [2,4,6]),
 1429:     [1,2,3,5,7] = lists:umerge(F, [2], [1,2,3,5,7]),
 1430:     [1,2,3,4,5,7] = lists:umerge(F, [2,4], [1,2,3,4,5,7]),
 1431:     [1,2,3,4,5,6,7] = lists:umerge(F, [2,4,6], [1,2,3,4,5,6,7]),
 1432: 
 1433:     L1 = [{a,1},{a,3},{a,5},{a,7}],
 1434:     L2 = [{b,1},{b,3},{b,5},{b,7}],
 1435:     F2 = fun(X,Y) -> element(2,X) =< element(2,Y) end,
 1436:     L1 = lists:umerge(F2, L1, L2),
 1437:     [{b,2},{e,5},{c,11},{c,12},{c,21},{c,22}] =
 1438: 	lists:umerge(F2, [{e,5},{c,11},{c,12}], [{b,2},{c,21},{c,22}]),
 1439: 
 1440:     ok.
 1441: 
 1442: %% Reverse merge two lists while removing duplicates using a fun.
 1443: rufunmerge(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1444:     Two = [2,1],
 1445:     Six = [6,5,4,3,2,1],
 1446:     F = fun(X, Y) -> X =< Y end,
 1447: 
 1448:     %% 2-way reversed unique merge
 1449:     [] = lists:rumerge(F, [], []),
 1450:     Two = lists:rumerge(F, Two, []),
 1451:     Two = lists:rumerge(F, [], Two),
 1452:     Six = lists:rumerge(F, [5,3,1], [6,4,2]),
 1453:     Six = lists:rumerge(F, [6,4,2], [5,3,1]),
 1454:     Six = lists:rumerge(F, [3,2,1], [6,5,4]),
 1455:     Six = lists:rumerge(F, [6,5,4], [3,2,1]),
 1456:     Six = lists:rumerge(F, [4,3,2],[6,5,1]),
 1457:     [7,6,5,3,1] = lists:rumerge(F, [7,5,3,1], [6]),
 1458:     [7,6,5,4,3,1] = lists:rumerge(F, [7,5,3,1], [6,4]),
 1459:     [7,6,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge(F, [7,5,3,1], [6,4,2]),
 1460:     [7,5,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge(F, [2], [7,5,3,1]),
 1461:     [7,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge(F, [4,2], [7,5,3,1]),
 1462:     [7,6,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge(F, [6,4,2], [7,5,3,1]),
 1463: 
 1464:     [7,6,5,3,1] = lists:rumerge(F, [7,6,5,3,1], [6]),
 1465:     [7,6,5,4,3,1] = lists:rumerge(F, [7,6,5,4,3,1], [6,4]),
 1466:     [7,6,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge(F, [7,6,5,4,3,2,1], [6,4,2]),
 1467:     [7,5,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge(F, [2], [7,5,3,2,1]),
 1468:     [7,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge(F, [4,2], [7,5,4,3,2,1]),
 1469:     [7,6,5,4,3,2,1] = lists:rumerge(F, [6,4,2], [7,6,5,4,3,2,1]),
 1470: 
 1471:     F2 = fun(X,Y) -> element(1,X) =< element(1,Y) end,
 1472:     L1 = [{1,a},{1,b},{1,a}],
 1473:     L2 = [{1,a},{1,b},{1,a}],
 1474:     true = lists:umerge(F2, L1, L2) ==
 1475: 	lists:reverse(lists:rumerge(F, lists:reverse(L2), lists:reverse(L1))),
 1476: 
 1477:     L3 = [{c,11},{c,12},{e,5}],
 1478:     L4 = [{b,2},{c,21},{c,22}],
 1479:     true =
 1480: 	lists:umerge(F2, L3, L4) == 
 1481: 	lists:reverse(lists:rumerge(F2,lists:reverse(L3), lists:reverse(L4))),
 1482: 
 1483:     ok.
 1484: 
 1485: ufunsort_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1486:     ok = ufunsort_check(1, [], []),
 1487:     ok = ufunsort_check(1, [{a,b}], [{a,b}]),
 1488:     ok = ufunsort_check(1, [{a,b},{a,b}], [{a,b}]),
 1489:     ok = ufunsort_check(1, [{a,b},{b,c}], [{a,b},{b,c}]),
 1490:     ok = ufunsort_check(1, [{b,c},{a,b}], [{a,b},{b,c}]),
 1491:     ok = ufunsort_check(1,
 1492: 			[{1,e},{3,f},{2,y},{0,z},{x,14}],
 1493: 			[{0,z},{1,e},{2,y},{3,f},{x,14}]),
 1494:     ok = ufunsort_check(1,
 1495: 			[{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{2,b},{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},
 1496: 			 {2,b},{1,a}],
 1497: 			[{1,a},{2,b},{3,c}]),
 1498:     ok = ufunsort_check(1,
 1499: 			[{1,a},{1,a},{1,b},{1,b},{1,a},{2,a}],
 1500: 			[{1,a},{2,a}]),
 1501: 
 1502:     F = funsort_fun(1),
 1503:     L1 = [{1,a},{1,b},{1,a}],
 1504:     L2 = [{1,a},{1,b},{1,a}],
 1505:     ok = ufunsort_check(1, lists:keymerge(1, L1, L2),
 1506: 			lists:umerge(F, lists:usort(F, L1),
 1507: 				     lists:usort(F, L2))),
 1508:     L3 = [{1,a},{1,b},{1,a},{2,a}],
 1509:     ok = ufunsort_check(1, lists:keymerge(1, L3, L2),
 1510: 			lists:umerge(F, lists:usort(F, L3),
 1511: 				     lists:usort(F, L2))),
 1512:     L4 = [{1,b},{1,a}],
 1513:     ok = ufunsort_check(1, lists:keymerge(1, L1, L4),
 1514: 			lists:umerge(F, lists:usort(F, L1),
 1515: 				     lists:usort(F, L4))),
 1516:     L5 = [{1,a},{1,b},{1,a},{2,a}],
 1517:     ok = ufunsort_check(1, lists:keymerge(1, L5, []),
 1518: 			lists:umerge(F, lists:usort(F, L5), [])),
 1519:     L6 = [{3,a}],
 1520:     ok = ufunsort_check(1, lists:keymerge(1, L5, L6),
 1521: 			lists:umerge(F, lists:usort(F, L5),
 1522: 				     lists:usort(F, L6))),
 1523: 
 1524:     [{b,1},{c,1}] = lists:usort(F, [{c,1},{c,1},{b,1}]),
 1525:     [{a,0},{b,2},{c,3},{d,4}] =
 1526: 	lists:usort(F, [{d,4},{c,3},{b,2},{b,2},{a,0}]),
 1527:     [{a,0},{b,1},{c,1}] =
 1528: 	lists:usort(F, [{c,1},{b,1},{b,1},{b,2},{b,2},{a,0}]),
 1529:     [{a,0},{b,1},{c,1},{d,4}] =
 1530: 	lists:usort(F, [{c,1},{b,1},{b,2},{a,0},{a,0},{d,4},{d,4}]),
 1531: 
 1532:     SFun = fun(L) -> fun(X) -> ufunsort_check(1, X, L) end end,
 1533:     PL = [{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{6,f}],
 1534:     Ps = perms([{1,a},{2,b},{3,c},{4,d},{5,e},{6,f},{2,b},{1,a}]),
 1535:     lists:foreach(SFun(PL), Ps),
 1536: 
 1537:     ok.
 1538: 
 1539: %% usort/2 should be stable.
 1540: ufunsort_stable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1541:     ok = ufunsort_check(1, [{1,b},{1,c}], [{1,b}]),
 1542:     ok = ufunsort_check(1, [{1,c},{1,b}], [{1,c}]),
 1543:     ok = ufunsort_check(1,
 1544: 			[{1,c},{1,b},{2,x},{3,p},{2,a}],
 1545: 			[{1,c},{2,x},{3,p}]),
 1546: 
 1547:     ok = ufunsort_check_stability(bigfunlist(10)),
 1548:     ok = ufunsort_check_stability(bigfunlist(100)),
 1549:     ok = ufunsort_check_stability(bigfunlist(1000)),
 1550:     case erlang:system_info(modified_timing_level) of
 1551: 	undefined -> ok = ufunsort_check_stability(bigfunlist(10000));
 1552: 	_ -> ok
 1553:     end,
 1554:     ok.
 1555: 
 1556: %% usort/2 should exit when given bad arguments.
 1557: ufunsort_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1558:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:usort(1, [{1,b} , {1,c}])),
 1559:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch lists:usort(fun(X,Y) -> X =< Y end,
 1560: 				     [{1,b} | {1,c}])),
 1561:     ok.
 1562: 
 1563: %% usort/2 on big randomized lists.
 1564: ufunsort_rand(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1565:     ok = ufunsort_check3(1, biglist(10)),
 1566:     ok = ufunsort_check3(1, biglist(100)),
 1567:     ok = ufunsort_check3(1, biglist(1000)),
 1568:     ok = ufunsort_check3(1, biglist(10000)),
 1569: 
 1570:     ok = gen_ufunsort_check(1, ubiglist(100)),
 1571:     ok = gen_ufunsort_check(1, ubiglist(1000)),
 1572:     ok = gen_ufunsort_check(1, ubiglist(10000)),
 1573:     ok.
 1574: 
 1575: %% Check that usort/2 is stable and correct relative sort/2.
 1576: gen_ufunsort_check(I, Input) ->
 1577:     U = ufunsort(I, Input),
 1578:     S = funsort(I, Input),
 1579:     case U == no_dups_keys(S, I) of
 1580: 	true ->
 1581: 	    ok;
 1582: 	false ->
 1583: 	    io:format("~w~n", [Input]),
 1584: 	    erlang:error(gen_ufunsort_check)
 1585:     end.
 1586: 
 1587: %% Used for checking that the first copy is kept.
 1588: ufunsort_check_stability(L) ->
 1589:     I = 1,
 1590:     U = ufunsort(I, L),
 1591:     S = no_dups(funsort(I, L)),
 1592:     check_stab(L, U, S, "usort/2", "sort/2").
 1593: 
 1594: ufunsort_check3(I, Input) ->
 1595:     ucheck_sorted(I, 3, Input, ufunsort(I, Input)).
 1596: 
 1597: %%% Keysort a list, check that the returned list is what we expected,
 1598: %%% and that it is actually sorted.
 1599: ufunsort_check(I, Input, Expected) ->
 1600:     Expected = ufunsort(I, Input),
 1601:     ucheck_sorted(I, Input, Expected).
 1602: 
 1603: %% Do a keysort
 1604: ufunsort(I, L) ->
 1605:     lists:usort(funsort_fun(I), L).
 1606: 
 1607: funsort_fun(I) ->
 1608:     fun(A, B) when tuple_size(A) >= I, tuple_size(B) >= I ->
 1609:             element(I, A) =< element(I, B)
 1610:     end.
 1611: 
 1612: check_stab(L, U, S, US, SS) ->
 1613:     UP = explicit_pid(U),
 1614:     SP = explicit_pid(S),
 1615:     case UP == SP of
 1616: 	true ->
 1617: 	    ok;
 1618: 	false ->
 1619: 	    io:format("In: ~w~n", [explicit_pid(L)]),
 1620: 	    io:format("~s: ~w~n", [US, UP]),
 1621: 	    io:format("~s:  ~w~n", [SS, SP]),
 1622: 	    erlang:error(unstable)
 1623:     end.
 1624: 
 1625: %%%------------------------------------------------------------
 1626: %%% Generate lists of given length, containing 3-tuples with
 1627: %%% random integer elements in the range 0..44 as elements 1 and 2.
 1628: %%% Element 3 in the tuple is the position of the tuple in the list.
 1629: 
 1630: biglist(N) ->
 1631:     rand:seed(exsplus),
 1632:     biglist(N, []).
 1633: 
 1634: biglist(0, L) ->
 1635:     L;
 1636: biglist(N, L) ->
 1637:     E = random_tuple(45, N),
 1638:     biglist(N-1, [E|L]).
 1639: 
 1640: %%%------------------------------------------------------------
 1641: %%% Generate lists of given length, containing 2-tuples with
 1642: %%% random integer elements in the range 0..10 as element 1.
 1643: %%% Element 2 in the tuple is a random integer in the range 0..5.
 1644: %%% No sequence number.
 1645: 
 1646: ubiglist(N) ->
 1647:     rand:seed(exsplus),
 1648:     ubiglist(N, []).
 1649: 
 1650: ubiglist(0, L) ->
 1651:     L;
 1652: ubiglist(N, L) ->
 1653:     E = urandom_tuple(11, 6),
 1654:     ubiglist(N-1, [E|L]).
 1655: 
 1656: urandom_tuple(N, I) ->
 1657:     R1 = randint(N),
 1658:     R2 = randint(I),
 1659:     {R1, R2}.
 1660: 
 1661: %%%------------------------------------------------------------
 1662: %%% Generate lists of given length, containing 2-tuples with random
 1663: %%% integer elements in the range 0..10 as elements 1. All tuples have
 1664: %%% the same function as element 2, but every function is created in a
 1665: %%% unique process. ==/2 will return 'true' for any pair of functions,
 1666: %%% but erlang:fun_info(Fun, pid) can be used for distinguishing
 1667: %%% functions created in different processes. The pid acts like a
 1668: %%% sequence number.
 1669: 
 1670: bigfunlist(N) ->
 1671:     rand:seed(exsplus),
 1672:     bigfunlist_1(N).
 1673: 
 1674: bigfunlist_1(N) when N < 30000 -> % Now (R8) max 32000 different pids.
 1675:     case catch bigfunlist(N, 0, []) of
 1676: 	{'EXIT', _} ->
 1677: 	    bigfunlist_1(N);
 1678: 	Reply ->
 1679: 	    Reply
 1680:     end.
 1681: 
 1682: bigfunlist(0, _P, L) ->
 1683:     lists:reverse(L);
 1684: bigfunlist(N, P, L) ->
 1685:     {E, NP} = random_funtuple(P, 11),
 1686:     bigfunlist(N-1, NP, [E | L]).
 1687: 
 1688: random_funtuple(P, N) ->
 1689:     R = randint(N),
 1690:     F = make_fun(),
 1691:     NP = fun_pid(F),
 1692:     true = NP > P,
 1693:     {{R, F}, NP}.
 1694: 
 1695: make_fun() ->
 1696:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE, make_fun, [self()]),
 1697:     receive {Pid, Fun} -> Fun end.
 1698: 
 1699: make_fun(Pid) ->
 1700:     Pid ! {self(), fun (X) -> {X, Pid} end}.
 1701: 
 1702: fun_pid(Fun) ->
 1703:     erlang:fun_info(Fun, pid).
 1704: 
 1705: random_tuple(N, Seq) ->
 1706:     R1 = randint(N),
 1707:     R2 = randint(N),
 1708:     {R1, R2, Seq}.
 1709: 
 1710: randint(N) ->
 1711:     trunc(rand:uniform() * N).
 1712: 
 1713: %% The first "duplicate" is kept.
 1714: no_dups([]) ->
 1715:     [];
 1716: no_dups([H | T]) ->
 1717:     no_dups(H, T, []).
 1718: 
 1719: no_dups(H, [H1 | T], L) when H == H1 ->
 1720:     no_dups(H, T, L);
 1721: no_dups(H, [H1 | T], L) ->
 1722:     no_dups(H1, T, [H | L]);
 1723: no_dups(H, [], L) ->
 1724:     lists:reverse([H | L]).
 1725: 
 1726: %% The first "duplicate" is kept.
 1727: no_dups_keys([], _I) ->
 1728:     [];
 1729: no_dups_keys([H | T], I) ->
 1730:     no_dups_keys(H, T, [], I).
 1731: 
 1732: no_dups_keys(H, [H1 | T], L, I) when element(I, H) == element(I, H1) ->
 1733:     no_dups_keys(H, T, L, I);
 1734: no_dups_keys(H, [H1 | T], L, I) ->
 1735:     no_dups_keys(H1, T, [H | L], I);
 1736: no_dups_keys(H, [], L, _I) ->
 1737:     lists:reverse([H | L]).
 1738: 
 1739: perms([]) ->
 1740:     [[]];
 1741: perms(L) ->
 1742:     [[H|T] || H <- L, T <- perms(L--[H])].
 1743: 
 1744: %%%------------------------------------------------------------
 1745: %%% Test the sort routines with randomly generated lists.
 1746: 
 1747: -record(state, {sort = 0, usort = 0, stable = 0}).
 1748: 
 1749: %% Run it interactively. 'stop' or 'info' recognized commands.
 1750: sort_loop() ->
 1751:     sort_loop(5000).
 1752: 
 1753: sort_loop(N) when is_integer(N), N > 0 ->
 1754:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, sloop, [N]),
 1755:     sort_loop_1(Pid).
 1756: 
 1757: sort_loop_1(Pid) ->
 1758:     case io:get_line('? ') of
 1759: 	eof ->
 1760: 	    ok;
 1761: 	"stop\n" ->
 1762: 	    Pid ! {self(), stop},
 1763: 	    receive {Pid, S} -> display_state(S) end;
 1764: 	"info\n" ->
 1765: 	    Pid ! {self(), info},
 1766: 	    receive {Pid, S} -> display_state(S) end,
 1767: 	    sort_loop_1(Pid);
 1768: 	_Other ->
 1769: 	    sort_loop_1(Pid)
 1770:     end.
 1771: 
 1772: sloop(N) ->
 1773:     rand:seed(exsplus),
 1774:     sloop(N, #state{}).
 1775: 
 1776: sloop(N, S) ->
 1777:     receive
 1778: 	{From, stop} ->
 1779: 	    From ! {self(), S};
 1780: 	{From, info} ->
 1781: 	    From ! {self(), S},
 1782: 	    sloop(N, S)
 1783:     after 0 ->
 1784: 	    Len = randint(N),
 1785: 	    NS = case randint(3) of
 1786: 		     0 ->
 1787: 			 BL = biglist(Len, []),
 1788: 			 ok = check(BL),
 1789: 			 ok = keysort_check3(1, BL),
 1790: 			 ok = funsort_check3(1, BL),
 1791: 			 S#state{sort = S#state.sort + 1};
 1792: 		     1 ->
 1793: 			 BL = ubiglist(Len, []),
 1794: 			 ok = ucheck(BL),
 1795: 			 ok = gen_ukeysort_check(1, BL),
 1796: 			 ok = gen_ufunsort_check(1, BL),
 1797: 			 S#state{usort = S#state.usort + 1};
 1798: 		     2 ->
 1799: 			 BL = bigfunlist(Len),
 1800: 			 %% ok = check_stability(BL),
 1801: 			 ok = ucheck_stability(BL),
 1802: 			 ok = ukeysort_check_stability(BL),
 1803: 			 ok = ufunsort_check_stability(BL),
 1804: 			 S#state{stable = S#state.stable + 1}
 1805: 		 end,
 1806: 	    sloop(N, NS)
 1807:     end.
 1808: 
 1809: display_state(S) ->    
 1810:     io:format("sort:   ~p~n", [S#state.sort]),
 1811:     io:format("usort:  ~p~n", [S#state.usort]),
 1812:     io:format("stable: ~p~n", [S#state.stable]).
 1813: 
 1814: %% This version of sort/1 is really stable; the order of equal
 1815: %% elements is kept. It is used for checking the current
 1816: %% implementation of usort/1 etc.
 1817: 
 1818: lsort([X, Y | L] = L0) when X =< Y ->
 1819:     case L of
 1820: 	[] -> 
 1821: 	    L0;
 1822: 	[Z] when Y =< Z ->
 1823: 	    L0;
 1824: 	[Z] when X =< Z ->
 1825: 	    [X, Z, Y];
 1826: 	[Z] ->
 1827: 	    [Z, X, Y];
 1828: 	_ ->
 1829: 	    split_1(X, Y, L, [], [])
 1830:     end;
 1831: lsort([X, Y | L]) ->
 1832:     case L of
 1833: 	[] ->
 1834: 	    [Y, X];
 1835: 	[Z] when X =< Z ->
 1836: 	    [Y, X | L];
 1837: 	[Z] when Y =< Z ->
 1838: 	    [Y, Z, X];
 1839: 	[Z] ->
 1840: 	    [Z, Y, X];
 1841: 	_ ->
 1842: 	    split_2(X, Y, L, [], [])
 1843:     end;
 1844: lsort([_] = L) ->
 1845:     L;
 1846: lsort([] = L) ->
 1847:     L.
 1848: 
 1849: split_1(X, Y, [Z | L], R, Rs) when Z >= Y ->
 1850:     split_1(Y, Z, L, [X | R], Rs);
 1851: split_1(X, Y, [Z | L], R, Rs) when Z >= X ->
 1852:     split_1(Z, Y, L, [X | R], Rs);
 1853: split_1(X, Y, [Z | L], [], Rs) ->
 1854:     split_1(X, Y, L, [Z], Rs);
 1855: split_1(X, Y, [Z | L], R, Rs) ->
 1856:     split_1_1(X, Y, L, R, Rs, Z);
 1857: split_1(X, Y, [], R, Rs) ->
 1858:     rmergel([[Y, X | R] | Rs], [], asc).
 1859: 
 1860: split_1_1(X, Y, [Z | L], R, Rs, S) when Z >= Y ->
 1861:     split_1_1(Y, Z, L, [X | R], Rs, S);
 1862: split_1_1(X, Y, [Z | L], R, Rs, S) when Z >= X ->
 1863:     split_1_1(Z, Y, L, [X | R], Rs, S);
 1864: split_1_1(X, Y, [Z | L], R, Rs, S) when S =< Z ->
 1865:     split_1(S, Z, L, [], [[Y, X | R] | Rs]);
 1866: split_1_1(X, Y, [Z | L], R, Rs, S) ->
 1867:     split_1(Z, S, L, [], [[Y, X | R] | Rs]);
 1868: split_1_1(X, Y, [], R, Rs, S) ->
 1869:     rmergel([[S], [Y, X | R] | Rs], [], asc).
 1870: 
 1871: split_2(X, Y, [Z | L], R, Rs) when Z < Y ->
 1872:     split_2(Y, Z, L, [X | R], Rs);
 1873: split_2(X, Y, [Z | L], R, Rs) when Z < X ->
 1874:     split_2(Z, Y, L, [X | R], Rs);
 1875: split_2(X, Y, [Z | L], [], Rs) ->
 1876:     split_2(X, Y, L, [Z], Rs);
 1877: split_2(X, Y, [Z | L], R, Rs) ->
 1878:     split_2_1(X, Y, L, R, Rs, Z);
 1879: split_2(X, Y, [], R, Rs) ->
 1880:     mergel([[Y, X | R] | Rs], [], desc).
 1881: 
 1882: split_2_1(X, Y, [Z | L], R, Rs, S) when Z < Y ->
 1883:     split_2_1(Y, Z, L, [X | R], Rs, S);
 1884: split_2_1(X, Y, [Z | L], R, Rs, S) when Z < X ->
 1885:     split_2_1(Z, Y, L, [X | R], Rs, S);
 1886: split_2_1(X, Y, [Z | L], R, Rs, S) when S > Z ->
 1887:     split_2(S, Z, L, [], [[Y, X | R] | Rs]);
 1888: split_2_1(X, Y, [Z | L], R, Rs, S) ->
 1889:     split_2(Z, S, L, [], [[Y, X | R] | Rs]);
 1890: split_2_1(X, Y, [], R, Rs, S) ->
 1891:     mergel([[S], [Y, X | R] | Rs], [], desc).
 1892: 
 1893: mergel([[] | L], Acc, O) ->
 1894:     mergel(L, Acc, O);
 1895: mergel([T1, [H2 | T2] | L], Acc, asc) ->
 1896:     mergel(L, [merge2_1(T1, H2, T2, []) | Acc], asc);
 1897: mergel([[H2 | T2], T1 | L], Acc, desc) ->
 1898:     mergel(L, [merge2_1(T1, H2, T2, []) | Acc], desc);
 1899: mergel([L], [], _O) ->
 1900:     L;
 1901: mergel([L], Acc, O) ->
 1902:     rmergel([lists:reverse(L, []) | Acc], [], O);
 1903: mergel([], [], _O) ->
 1904:     [];
 1905: mergel([], Acc, O) ->
 1906:     rmergel(Acc, [], O);
 1907: mergel([A, [] | L], Acc, O) ->
 1908:     mergel([A | L], Acc, O);
 1909: mergel([A, B, [] | L], Acc, O) ->
 1910:     mergel([A, B | L], Acc, O).
 1911: 
 1912: rmergel([[H2 | T2], T1 | L], Acc, asc) ->
 1913:     rmergel(L, [rmerge2_1(T1, H2, T2, []) | Acc], asc);
 1914: rmergel([T1, [H2 | T2] | L], Acc, desc) ->
 1915:     rmergel(L, [rmerge2_1(T1, H2, T2, []) | Acc], desc);
 1916: rmergel([L], Acc, O) ->
 1917:     mergel([lists:reverse(L, []) | Acc], [], O);
 1918: rmergel([], Acc, O) ->
 1919:     mergel(Acc, [], O).
 1920: 
 1921: merge2_1([H1 | T1], H2, T2, M) when H1 =< H2 ->
 1922:     merge2_1(T1, H2, T2, [H1 | M]);
 1923: merge2_1([H1 | T1], H2, T2, M) ->
 1924:     merge2_2(T1, H1, T2, [H2 | M]);
 1925: merge2_1([], H2, T2, M) ->
 1926:     lists:reverse(T2, [H2 | M]).
 1927: 
 1928: merge2_2(T1, H1, [H2 | T2], M) when H1 =< H2 ->
 1929:     merge2_1(T1, H2, T2, [H1 | M]);
 1930: merge2_2(T1, H1, [H2 | T2], M) ->
 1931:     merge2_2(T1, H1, T2, [H2 | M]);
 1932: merge2_2(T1, H1, [], M) ->
 1933:     lists:reverse(T1, [H1 | M]).
 1934: 
 1935: rmerge2_1([H1 | T1], H2, T2, M) when H1 =< H2 ->
 1936:     rmerge2_2(T1, H1, T2, [H2 | M]);
 1937: rmerge2_1([H1 | T1], H2, T2, M) ->
 1938:     rmerge2_1(T1, H2, T2, [H1 | M]);
 1939: rmerge2_1([], H2, T2, M) ->
 1940:     lists:reverse(T2, [H2 | M]).
 1941: 
 1942: rmerge2_2(T1, H1, [H2 | T2], M) when H1 =< H2 ->
 1943:     rmerge2_2(T1, H1, T2, [H2 | M]);
 1944: rmerge2_2(T1, H1, [H2 | T2], M) ->
 1945:     rmerge2_1(T1, H2, T2, [H1 | M]);
 1946: rmerge2_2(T1, H1, [], M) ->
 1947:     lists:reverse(T1, [H1 | M]).
 1948: 
 1949: 
 1950: 
 1951: %% This version of keysort/2 is really stable; the order of equal
 1952: %% elements is kept. It is used for checking the current
 1953: %% implementation of ukeysort/2 etc.
 1954: 
 1955: lkeysort(Index, L) when is_integer(Index), Index > 0 ->
 1956:     case L of
 1957: 	[] -> L;
 1958: 	[_] -> L;
 1959: 	[X, Y | T] ->
 1960: 	    EX = element(Index, X),
 1961: 	    EY = element(Index, Y),
 1962: 	    if
 1963: 		EX =< EY ->
 1964: 		    keysplit_1(Index, X, EX, Y, EY, T, [], []);
 1965: 		true ->
 1966: 		    keysplit_2(Index, Y, EY, T, [X])
 1967: 	    end
 1968:     end.
 1969: 
 1970: keysplit_1(I, X, EX, Y, EY, [Z | L], R, Rs) ->
 1971:     EZ = element(I, Z),
 1972:     if 
 1973: 	EY =< EZ ->
 1974: 	    keysplit_1(I, Y, EY, Z, EZ, L, [X | R], Rs);
 1975: 	EX =< EZ ->
 1976: 	    keysplit_1(I, Z, EZ, Y, EY, L, [X | R], Rs);
 1977: 	true, R == [] ->
 1978: 	    keysplit_1(I, X, EX, Y, EY, L, [Z], Rs);
 1979: 	true ->
 1980: 	    keysplit_1_1(I, X, EX, Y, EY, L, R, Rs, Z, EZ)
 1981:     end;
 1982: keysplit_1(I, X, _EX, Y, _EY, [], R, Rs) ->
 1983:     rkeymergel(I, [[Y, X | R] | Rs], []).
 1984: 
 1985: %% One out-of-order element, S.
 1986: keysplit_1_1(I, X, EX, Y, EY, [Z | L], R, Rs, S, ES) ->
 1987:     EZ = element(I, Z),
 1988:     if
 1989: 	EY =< EZ ->
 1990: 	    keysplit_1_1(I, Y, EY, Z, EZ, L, [X | R], Rs, S, ES);
 1991: 	EX =< EZ ->
 1992: 	    keysplit_1_1(I, Z, EZ, Y, EY, L, [X | R], Rs, S, ES);
 1993: 	ES =< EZ ->
 1994: 	    keysplit_1(I, S, ES, Z, EZ, L, [], [[Y, X | R] | Rs]);
 1995: 	true ->
 1996: 	    keysplit_1(I, Z, EZ, S, ES, L, [], [[Y, X | R] | Rs])
 1997:     end;
 1998: keysplit_1_1(I, X, _EX, Y, _EY, [], R, Rs, S, _ES) ->
 1999:     rkeymergel(I, [[S], [Y, X | R] | Rs], []).
 2000: 
 2001: %% Descending.
 2002: keysplit_2(I, Y, EY, [Z | L], R) ->
 2003:     EZ = element(I, Z),
 2004:     if
 2005: 	EY =< EZ ->
 2006:             keysplit_1(I, Y, EY, Z, EZ, L, [], [lists:reverse(R, [])]);
 2007:         true ->
 2008:             keysplit_2(I, Z, EZ, L, [Y | R])
 2009:     end;
 2010: keysplit_2(_I, Y, _EY, [], R) ->
 2011:     [Y | R].
 2012: 
 2013: keymergel(I, [T1, [H2 | T2] | L], Acc) ->
 2014:     keymergel(I, L, [keymerge2_1(I, T1, element(I, H2), H2, T2, []) | Acc]);
 2015: keymergel(_I, [L], []) ->
 2016:     L;
 2017: keymergel(I, [L], Acc) ->
 2018:     rkeymergel(I, [lists:reverse(L, []) | Acc], []);
 2019: keymergel(I, [], Acc) ->
 2020:     rkeymergel(I, Acc, []).
 2021: 
 2022: rkeymergel(I, [[H2 | T2], T1 | L], Acc) ->
 2023:     rkeymergel(I, L, [rkeymerge2_1(I, T1, element(I, H2), H2, T2, []) | Acc]);
 2024: rkeymergel(I, [L], Acc) ->
 2025:     keymergel(I, [lists:reverse(L, []) | Acc], []);
 2026: rkeymergel(I, [], Acc) ->
 2027:     keymergel(I, Acc, []).
 2028: 
 2029: keymerge2_1(I, [H1 | T1], E2, H2, T2, M) ->
